Reviews.Title: “stylish and brilliantly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barnesgolfer
Reviews.Content: This is a super place, very close to the main mosques and palaces and with comfortable and spacious rooms (though rather nasty foam pillows could be improved upon) and a super roof terrace (managed by the friendly Hassan) with many comfortable rattan chairs and tables with a 'to die for' view of the blue mosque and the sea of marmara. Breakfasts were also very acceptable. Reception staff were helpful too. We would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for sightseeing, competent and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: We liked lots of things about this hotel - the rooms were well-appointed, breakfast was extremely good and the staff were friendly and helpful. It was also very convenient for sightseeing. The main problem was not the fault of the hotel at all - just that Sultanahmet in full tourist swing is exhausting. We preferred staying (and especially eating) on the Asian side. That said, if you want to be able to walk to the main sights, this is the place to be. The roof bar with views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara is a particular highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: azeusa
Reviews.Content: Well-appointed, and perfectly located in the touristy part of town. Plenty of restaurant choices, although for variety I'd head to Taksim myself. The reception was never less than friendly, and breakfast, served upstairs with a view or in the elegant downstairs in rainy weather, was adequate, fresh and with tea/ coffee generously dispensed. Only gripe might be the spotty wifi during the stay, but a man was there fixing it and there was good connection in the lobby. Compared to the other hotel I stayed at in the vicinity, Sari Konak was immeasurably superior. If I were to stay in the area again, Sari Konak would be a top choice for a good balance of budget (not strictly cheap, but not four seasons extravagant) and solid comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with friendly staff right next to all the cool stuff”
Reviews.Author: Biggie348
Reviews.Content: We really liked this place. Our room was cute and comfy. The staff were really helpful and friendly and the place had a nice vibe to it. Breakfast consisted of dried fruits, yoghurt, good bread, a selection of cold meats, olives & fresh fruit. Really recommend it

Reviews.Title: “A Simple, Elegant Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Kate3427
Reviews.Content: What an absolutely lovely hotel. The place is just perfect and perfectly decorated. Neither too much or too little. It feels much more like you are staying in someone's home than in a hotel. But, that is not to say that it is folksy. Just that is it so lovingly put together, it doesn't feel at all corporate or mass-produced. Great little breakfast buffet, in such a beautiful breakfast room. We didn't want to leave. The staff absolutely cannot do enough for you and every recommendation they gave us was superb. We were with our two kids (12 and 15), but this would also be a great get away for a couple. All the furnishings are very high quality. The bathrooms were good-sized and well-appointed. Steps from fab shops and restaurants and the Arasta Bazaar. A five-minute walk to Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, maybe seven mins to the Basilica Cistern and 15 minutes to the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly C
Reviews.Content: Sari Konak Otel is a quaint hotel in a fantastic location near the Blue Mosque, Arasta Bazaar (small bazaar) and Hagia Sophie. We enjoyed many conversations with the front desk staff - Hasan and Mustafa. They offered many suggestions of sights to see, places to eat, booked our day trips and transportation as well as answered our endless list of questions with a smile. We stayed in the family suite to accommodate our family of 4. We had plenty of room to rest. The bathroom was spacious, but it was a bath tub / no shower with no curtain - made showering a little adventurous to not get the rest of the bathroom wet and no fan/vent to release the steam. There was a small mildew issue along the wall of the bath tub. Overall, the room was very clean. The morning breakfast was plentiful with cereal, yogurt, breads, fruit and tea. Not a lot of seating in the breakfast area as we were a touring group of 10, but they quickly added more tables to accommodate the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Class of Hotel to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMumBles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on feb 2 & 3. Nice hotel, good service and helpful staff. The bed was so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: A first time in Istanbul is an enriching experience â€“â€“ to be in Istanbul is to be rich. Sari Konak is a treasure in the heart of of old Istanbul. What a pleasure to walk up the hill to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia every morning! What a joy to bask on the roof in the Turkish sun and view the Sea of Marmara. Service at this boutique hotel is truly exceptional and each front desk clerk - Hussan, Mustafa and Segun - is helpful and memorable in his own way. Breakfasts are luscious and the buffet setting is a delight. What a blessing to have discovered the Sari Konak Oteli!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: frinxy
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice, helpful and polite. There was a bit of a mix up with the booking site we used but the person working there helped us in every way so it was no problem. The rooms are clean. Our room was big but the cheaper rooms are smaller, for some guests it might be a problem. It is quiet. The city center is not very far away. The food was very good, I specially loved having breakfast on the roof with a view of the Bosporus and Blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BVUSA
Reviews.Content: I have neglected to write this review since our trip in July, 2010. The Hotel Sari Konak is a hotel with a wonderful staff that is friendly and extremely helpful, a beautiful setting, clean and spacious rooms, a fresh breakfast every morning and the views atop the restaraunt after breakfast andin the early evening are breathtaking. In a word: Fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: Sari Konak is the place to stay while in Istanbul. I stayed there earlier this month for 1wk w/ my wife, and 2 young kids. The rooms were very nice, location was awesome, and the staff were amazing. I travel quite a bit and I stay at top hotels but this place felt like home away from home. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My family and I want to thank Eser, Mustafa, and Hasan for their outstanding service and exceptional courtesy (they even helped me w/ my little knowledge of Turkish and that was priceless). I also apologize for not remembering everyone's name. I definitely recommend the location to first timers, this is the better, nicer part of Sultan Ahmet, we walked couple of times all the way to Taksim!!! Breakfast was delicious, I highly recommend it!! We cannot wait to be back and we;re already looking for the next time off to spend it in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Connecting People during breakfast”
Reviews.Author: willemkuijpers
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located in the old centre of Istanbul. A very helpful and friendly staff makes your stay a wonderful experience..During breakfast people did easy connect to each other and shared their experiences...After a day in the city you can easily digest all you have seen that day at the roof terrace with a good glass of wine served by Hasan

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little Hotel for adults and older children”
Reviews.Author: nipperdog
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing as it was between the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya. Great places to walk around to in this old part of town. We stayed in suite 504 which is in attached annex on the third floor of a cute narrow marble spiral staircase. The 2 bdr suite was luxurious and beautifully renovated-as nice as pics. Being in an old building, the walls were thin and I was constantly telling my three kids to stop making noise. The breakfast was good and fresh. They had that amazing yougurt, boiled eggs, dried fruits, some fresh fruit, amazing homemade jams, bread, cheeses, olives, and some cereal. They charge extra 7 TL for fresh orange juice and 10TL for an omlette, but we never felt the need to get the extras as the food was adequate. If you are staying more than 5 days, you might get tired of it, but for the five of us it was perfect. I only wish they kept the coffee pot outside somewhere so we can get refills on our own and not disturb the staff every 5 minutes. I also wish they offered it till 11 am and not 10:30 am. I must say that we were always late getting there and they always kindly waited for us even tough they were supposed to end it at 10:30. This is the only time you can have your complimentary tea/coffee and food. I've discovered that one afternoon when I was waiting with sleeping baby (can't carry stroller up 3 flights of stairs, so they were very kind and kept it in lobby for us) to wake up. I ordered tea around 5 pm and was charged 5 TL. So tea is not complimentary in the lobby (you have it in your room for free). Also, the advertised 5 o'clock tea/wine in the lobby is not complimentary. The people were always kind and helpful, and even though they never said anything about our 3 loud kids, I felt that we would of been more at ease at a hotel with an elevator, pool and larger lobby for the kids ( and probably thicker walls). This is a unique, beautiful and really well maintained family run boutique hotel that I loved and wish I could return without little ones in tow. It is also more romantic than anything. I was told The Orient Express is an option if you have kids under 5. If I ever returned to Istanbul without my kids, I would stay here again as it is truly beautiful, well kept, and has great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a short layover. Took the Tram from airport with one transfer and a short 5 minute walk to Sari Konak.”
Reviews.Author: Peterg0419
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a prefect choice after working 3 hard weeks in Kenya on a charity project. Clean, quiet, great sheets, water pressure and centrally located in a great part of old town. The staff bent over backwards to insure we were comfortable and even prepared to-go sandwiches since we departed before breakfast. (breakfast was actually ready before departure but the staff wanted to be sure we did not leave on an empty stomach) We will definitely return. Beware of the students wishing to practice their English. After exiting the tram we were approached & personally escorted to several local attractions and then taken to the student/saleman's uncle's rug shop. We walked out after 30 mins. into the high pressure sales presentation. It wasn't all that bad but consumed precious time during our short layover. November is a great time to visit as the crowds are light.

Reviews.Title: “Central position and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SATraveller
Reviews.Content: Great position in Sultanahmet between the Blue Mosque and the Marmara Sea and walking distance of the Hippodrome and Topaki Palace. A good continental breakfast with good service is included. The covered roof top terrace is excellent. Free wi-fi throughout. Front desk very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JDFOttawaCanada
Reviews.Content: Our criteria for a Sultanahmet hotel were 1. A rooftop terrace with a view for breakfast and lounging. 2. A spacious room. 3. Bright and handy to restaurants and attractions. The Sari Konak had it all. From the terrace we could see the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. We were in deluxe room 604 which had a direct staircase to the roof; room 603 looked lovely too and has one less flight of stairs from the lobby. We liked that it had 2 comfortable arm chairs. Many restaurants were only a few minutes away. Our favourite, where we ate 3 of our 6 nights, was Albura Kathisma Cafe Restaurant. Wonderful food, friendly staff, and comfortable seating. Ask to see the excavation under the restaurant. Just a down the street from the hotel, at number 18, is the Hayat Cafe where we had a generous, excellent lunch on our last day. We wished we had tried it sooner. Airport transportation arranged by the hotel worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: lisasusan25
Reviews.Content: Loved this boutique hotel! Stayed in a beautiful suite with my husband, newborn and mother in law. The staff provides great service, arranged crib for the baby, booked a Turkish bath for us and give you a great map and orientation to the area at check in. Lovely room and hotel in an awesome neighborhood. You can walk to great shops and restaurants right outside the door of the hotel, but still quiet neighborhood that is walking distance from the Arasta Bazaar, public transport and Grand Bazaar, along with Blue Mosque. Very good breakfast with good variety of food. Good views from the rooftop where you could lounge.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: SDias
Reviews.Content: Besides not accommodating one extra person for one night, everything was perfect. The rooms were SO CLEAN! The beds were relatively comfortable for Turkey i.e. it felt like there was a little padding instead of sleeping on lumpy bricks. The breakfast was fresh and tasty and the terrace was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Again”
Reviews.Author: Crads4
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Sari Konak. Once again we thoroughly enjoyed this hotel with its excellent personnel who make you feel most welcom. It is perfectly situated with wonderful views from the breakfast terrace. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenKris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for four nights after finishing a 11 day cruise in Istanbul . The hotel is small and personal with excellent reception staff who are very helpful . Our room was very clean and comfortable with a modern bathroom . Breakfast which was served on the the terrace was good with spectacular with views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus Strait . Location in Sultanahmet is excellent near mosques , musueums and the Arasta Bazaar -a mini Grand Bazaar . Would recommend and certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing, Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Emily C
Reviews.Content: We spent the last week of our 6 week honeymoon in Istanbul at the Sari Konak. First, it is in an absolute perfect location for visiting Blue Mosque, the Cisterns, restaurants, and shopping. The breakfast was absolutely memorable; figs, yogurt, eggs, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, and much more. The customer service was fantastic. We even had the owner come to our breakfast table and chat with us, friendly and genuine. Our room was so comfortable, clean, and cute that I took photos of the decorations in hopes of remodeling in a similar fashion one day. I've recommended this B&B to two different parties traveling to Istanbul recently. Thanks for the perfect conclusion to our honeymoon!!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: agoodteech
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel greets you with a cold drink in the "living room" and a personal welcome complete with maps and recommendations. The rooms are spotless and the bowl of turkish delight candy adds a tasty touch. The hotel is perfectly located and the staff is warm and gracious. You feel as if you are staying in someone's well-appointed home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: JAYsb02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Sari Konak as the last stop on our honeymoon in Turkey, and we just absolutely loved this hotel. The location can't be beat, the views from the rooftop deck are fantastic, and the service staff is incredibly warm and helpful! The room itself was a good size, which from what I've heard isn't so easy to come by when staying in Sultanahmet, and the bathroom was very clean and nicely equipped. We also had a small balcony overlooking the cobblestone street out front, that made for some nice people watching before bed in the evening. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly face at the front desk, who we ended up seeing there throughout most of our stay. He gave us a lay of the land, suggested some local attractions for us to visit and, to our great relief, provided us with two plug converters to use during our stay, after we had mistakenly left ours at our previous hotel. When I say that the hotel's location was perfect, I really can't stress how true this is. Everything that a tourist in Istanbul would want to see was within a very easy walking distance, and if you wanted to venture out, like we did, the tram stops are easy to get to, and the Metro system is very easy to navigate. Something else to note is that the Hotel Sari Konak (like most of the hotels we stayed in) provides a yummy Turkish breakfast on the rooftop deck, every morning. Its such a lovely way to start the day. And if you do as much sightseeing as we did in Istanbul, you will definitely need the fuel! Istanbul was our last stop in Turkey, and staying at the Hotel Sari Konak left us with nothing but beautiful memories, not only of our time in Istanbul, but of our time in Turkey as a whole. We look forward to returning to Istanbul soon, and we will definitely be staying at the Hotel Sari Konak when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Sari Konal Oteli - Istanbul - a great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rlw_chester
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel right in the middle of the major Istanbul sights (Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque etc). The staff are really helpful, friendly and speak excellent English; their recommendations for places to eat were spot on. The rooms aren't vast but are nicely decorated, well furnished and clean. The rooftop bar a great place to unwind and watch the sun set. One minor quibble - the breakfast gets a bit repetitive after 3 or 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “A definite "stay here"!!!”
Reviews.Author: ann marie k
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful location to stay for our first trip to Istanbul. The staff was wonderful, and the breakfast buffet every morning was great! The hotel helped us arrange tours, and the transport to and from the airport. We stayed in room #503. Very comfy and clean. I would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “So cute, nice people and great location”
Reviews.Author: 232MK232
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. The decor was great and the rooftop was lovely. Breakfast every day was really good. A few small things - at breakfast when we asked for prepared eggs (which weren't part of the buffet) we ended up being charged, which I wish they would have mentioned before checkout. Also, some of the wine seemed expensive. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. Hassan on the rooftop was really friendly and full of information about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, inviting”
Reviews.Author: alphys
Reviews.Content: My wife and i (60's) stayed here at the start and end of our three-week Turkish vacation. Location is perfect for first time Istanbul visitors--easy walk to sites or local trams/buses and ATM machines; roof top breakfast is very special as are the views of the sea and mosques. Staff is professional and caring--excellent advice for all needs. We were especially pleased to be greeted so warmly upon our return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Polo_Gallico
Reviews.Content: Hotel in Sultanahmet, the very touristic part of the city, close to Saint Sophia and the blue Mosque. Everything at hand, shops and restaurants. In a renovated wooden Istanbul house. Very nice terrace with a superb view. A little patio downstairs. PC in the basement + Wifi. Very good breakfast, no restaurant in the hotel, but there are plenty just outside. Comfortable and clean rooms, though not very large. Nice and "chic" interior decoration. Staff friendly and competent. I definetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Significant street noise in the morning was very disruptive”
Reviews.Author: TexasTourist4307
Reviews.Content: The location was good but we were very disappointed in our room because it was slightly below street level and the vendors outside our window began working about 6 am every morning. We had stayed at another hotel in Istanbul the previous year and much preferred it. Reservations at that hotel were not available when we booked our room.

Reviews.Title: “Just the boutique hotel in Istanbul I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Carina S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were extremely satisfied with the 5 nights we spent at the Sari Konak hotel in Istanbul (Sultanahmet area). And I'm pretty sure the hotel is consistently awesome--we stayed here twice (3 nights at the beginning of our trip, 2 nights at the end, with a friend's wedding in between). Location and pictures of the hotel's rooftop terrace on the website sold us on the place--and both turned out to be better than we imagined! The terrace had stunning views of the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and the Asian side across the Marmara Sea. Another treat was the wonderful bartender on the terrace, Hasan. We spent a couple lovely evenings chatting with him, learning about life in Istanbul and drinking Turkish wine. That really made our trip! The staff (that accommodated our many requests for help making restaurant reservations, etc), comfortable room, decor and hit-the-spot breakfast spread (again on the terrace) were all icing on the cake! The only tip I'd give (other than to stay here!) is that airport transport might be cheaper if you book it on your own. We used Backpackers service, which was 50 TL, and the transport the hotel arranges is normally 60 TL (but when we told them, they gave us the lower price for their service.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi07
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Turkey and we loved our stay at the Sari Konak. We stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of our 4 week holiday in Turkey and Greece. The staff were nice and there if you needed advice or help in any way. We arrived early in the morning from a long haul flight. We had organised a transfer with the hotel and someone was there waiting for us. When we arrived at the hotel we were offered a free breakast while we were waiting for our room to be ready which was really appreciated after our long flight. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was because of the view of the Blue Mosque from their roof terrace and it didn't disappoint. Its absolutely amazing up there. The breakfast is a typical Turkish breakfast and gives you a good start to the day. Our room was spacious and larger than we had booked. Our adult daughter joined us so they gave us a room with 2 seperate bedrooms, kitchen/dining area and lovely bathroom with hamen bath. The room was partly below ground which didn't detract any light from the rooms. It was not overly quiet but I am sure there are other rooms which would offer a quiet sleep. We didn't mind as the space suited our needs this time. There is a computor for guest use which we found very handy. The location is fantastic, better than I imagined. It is extremely close to all the major sights and right next to lovely restaurants. We really enjoyed our first stay in Istanbul and the Sari Konak played a big part in this. We could not fault this hotel and highly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tellatraveltale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Oct 2010. The location was very convenient, Aya Sofya and other attractions were a 5-10 minute walk. The first night we were booked in a suite which was on the left hand side soon as you entered the lobby. I do not remember the number of that suite. There was a sitting area with TV; it was very crammed. There were two small bedrooms, one with two single beds and another with a double bed and there was one bathroom. But I have to add that it was spotless clean, bathrooms were very clean as well. Later we shifted to another room that was courtyard facing, there was one queen bed and two single beds. I loved this room and was definitely better than the previous option even though it was a shared space. Felt like there was more room to move around. The interiors were bright and cheerful. The breakfast was served on the terrace which had beautiful view of the Bosphorous and Aya Sofya. There were different breads, jams, fresh fruits, juices, cold cuts, cheeses etc. But they charged extra for omelettes. They were very helpful when we requested for an early breakfast due to an early morning flight. A tray of sliced cucumbers and tomatoes, bread and cheeses were brought to our room the night before as we had a very early morning flight the next day. Overall it was nice quiet place to stay in the heart of Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start and end our stay in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Kekaha8
Reviews.Content: After a long trip we found our room to be very restful. The staff was attentive, helpful and very friendly. Breakfast on the terrace was beautiful to look at and delicous as were the breathtaking views. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: rivertrader46
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first eight nights of a two week trip to Turkey. This is a very good location for the tourist sights of Sultanahmet. We had a superior room on the second floor and it was very confortable. This is a small hotel and there was no noise to disturb our rest. We too loved the roof terrace. Breakfast each morning on the terrace was wonderful and we finished each night with a romantic drink on the terrace looking at the lighted Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and the ship traffic on the Bosphorus. The front desk staff was very helpful with local information.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: abager
Reviews.Content: Sari Konak is a pleasant, comfortable well-designed hotel close to the Blue Mosque and the Arast Bazaar. Staff are helpful and kind. Roof terrace, where breakfast is served, is particularly pleasant and has a spectacular view in all directions. Standard rooms are a little small, but there are larger rooms and suites. A good place to stay and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: CGW
Reviews.Content: Due to a mix up with dates we ended up spending 1 night a Hotel Sari Konak after 4 nights at Acra, which is a stones throw away. We stayed in a suite at Hotel Sari Konak which was very nice but the room could not compare to the family room at Acra. The Hotel Sari Konak has the advantage of a fabulous roof top terrace with great views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. The breakfast food is fine but not as good as Acra however. The suite was comfortable, with the two kids bed divided by a curtin. The airconditioning worked and the bathroom was excellent. There was a slight musty smell in the room. The staff were excellent, helped us out and let us check out late. The airport transfer the arranged was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Senorita12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sari Konak for five nights in November 2010 after reading a review in Lonely Planet magazine and the great reviews here on TripAdvisor. Sari Konak didnâ€™t disappoint. A beautiful boutique hotel in a fantastic location, this hotel couldnâ€™t have been better. We stayed in room 206 which was a good size and beautifully decorated with an excellent bathroom. The breakfast was really nice with a good choice of continental and Turkish breakfast foods and good coffee. There is a lovely roof terrace where you can have drinks and the view of the Blue Mosque is spectacular, so close you could almost touch it!! All the main sights and attractions of Sultanahmet are within very close walking distance - The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace etc. There are lots of good restaurants nearby too. Istanbul was fantastic, I loved everything about it, itâ€™s such a vibrant, buzzing, cultural city and there is so much to see and do. The Blue Mosque is every bit as stunning as it looks in photos. Being so close to the Blue Mosque we did hear the call to prayer early in the morning but that didnâ€™t bother us at all, itâ€™s all part of the experience. Sari Konak is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel tries hard, and it shows...”
Reviews.Author: MAWander
Reviews.Content: After much searching for a hotel where both my (senior citizen) parents and I could stay and be happy, I chose the Sari Konak. Most importantly, my parents were very comfortable there and we all enjoyed our stay. Hotel is very well located in the Sultanahmet area of the city. As a second-time visitor to Istanbul, I probably would have stayed in a different neighborhood, but for first-time visitors (my parents) interested in seeing the three main sites, you really can't go wrong. Loads of cafes and tourist restaurants in the immediate vicinity and a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. My parents' room was in the new wing and was quite spacious and comfortable for them. They were particularly pleased with the huge bed and the ample counter space in the bathroom for their things. My room was in the older section of the room and was fairly spartan and small, but comfortable enough and, in the end, exactly what I'd paid for. The real pleasure of the hotel, however, is the staff who work in the breakfast area and at the front desk. They could not have been more helpful, patient, and kind with all three of us. It seemed as if they'd never been asked the questions we asked -- their answers to us were as complete and generous as they must have been to the hundreds of other visitors who'd asked the same questions. They really seemed to want us to enjoy our stay, helped with booking transport for us, suggesting restaurants, and so on. Breakfast was a treat as the room faces the rear of the hotel and is quite bright and sunny in the mornings. Plenty of choices on offer (I particularly liked the thick yogurt, to which I added wonderfully plump walnuts, honey and dried figs) and an attentive staff re-filling bowls and making sure everything was just right. Hats off to the staff of this lovely small hotel. We felt so well cared for and would recommend this quiet little place with full confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: artscollective
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul and certainly not our last. We booked the hotel because of it's boutique nature, which would have been quite enough in itself but were not quite ready for the sight that awaited us from the roof terrace,.. had the blue mosque been any nearer we could have touched it, the other way, bospherus as far as the eye could see - enjoying a mojito with that kind of view..it doesn't get much better. The hotel and staff are faultless, spotless, and only too eager to help and suggest ideas. I left a dress behind in the room, this was returned to me in the UK within the week. The location meant we could explore all the major sights - blue mosque/hagia sophia/topkapi palace/grand bazaar by foot. Hustle & bustle are part of the Istanbul experience but returning to our quaint, relaxed, cobbled little hub in the evening was fantastic. Too many restaurants on the doorstep, too little time. Just brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, well-run, and beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: CorryC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few nights and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very close to some of the main sites in the city, and the view from the rooftop terrace looks like you fell into the picture on the front of a guidebook. We expected the view because of the location, but what we didn't expect is how much we would enjoy the hotel and its staff. The room was comfortable and cozy, the free wifi was fast and without hassle, and the breakfast was not only delicious but included drip coffee. After pounding the streets all day we would enjoy a drink or two on the rooftop, enjoying the company of Hasan, the rooftop manager. Hasan added greatly to our understanding of Turkish culture, history, and politics. We can't wait to come back to Istanbul, and when we do we hope to book a room at the Hotel Sari Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: greyman47
Reviews.Content: A family run hotel in a quiet part of Sultanahmet. We stayed in a deluxe room which was very clean and nicely furnished but rather cramped. There was no fridge or tea making facilites. The roof-top garden is very nice but has a rather interupted view of the Istanbul sky-line. The breakfast was very modest, but the coffee was good and our cups were kept full.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and we'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Dalton_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sari Konak represents an excellent value. It is convenient to the Old City sites. The views from terrace are great both at breakfast and while having a glass of wine at night. after a hard day of sight seeing. A beautiful night time view of the Blue Mosque. The staff is quite knowledgeable and very attentive to traveler's needs.The breakfast buffet has a good array of cold food, very traditional. Our room, 303, was very quiet even though it was on the street. The staff was very comfortable with English..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and friendly hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mango_eater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak Hotel in Istanbul for six nights on the second leg of our trip in Turkey. This was our second time at this hotel. We stayed in room 201 which was very nice. It had a small balcony that overlooked the front street. The bathroom was spacious. The people working at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the breakfasts each morning. The last day we were there they started breakfasts up on the rooftop terrace. The hotel is very nicely situated for touring around the city. We did not do any organized tours but used Rick Steve's Istanbul guide. Six full days allowed us to see everything we wanted to see. We ended eating dinner almost every night at Buhara 93 which was recommended in RIck Steve's guide. We really enjoyed the food there and it was nice and quiet. The food was like home-cooked food. This restaurant is located off the Hippodrome near the Blue Mosque. We much preferred shopping at the Arasta Bazaar which is very close to the hotel, about two blocks away. It is not as crazy as the Grand Bazaar and the shopkeepers are not as pushy. We really loved Turkey and would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely staff and in an excellent position for walking to all the sites”
Reviews.Author: shiraz1cat
Reviews.Content: We have just spent over a week at Hotel Sari Konak and it was very comfortable. The staff are all very helpful and make you most welcome. The position of the hotel is ideal for walking to all the main attractions in Sultanahmet - the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand bazaar and many more. Very good to finish at the end of your day in the rooftop terrace and bar - again looked after very well. The night time view of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop is fantastic. The room was cleaned everyday with fresh towels. Great shower. The breakfast selection was really good. The hotel is in a freindly street with shops and many resteraunts within a couple of minutes walk; very welcome after walking about all day. Only suggestion would be that although there was hanging space in the wardrobe we would have appreciated some drawers in the room, especially as we were staying for many days. We had to keep a lot of smaller items of clothing in our suitcases. It was quiet at night and had sleapt like a log! We would certainly return and can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: WildGil
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. We traveled to Istanbul for our honeymoon, and we loved every minute of our trip. The hotel arranged transportation from the Istanbul airport. There was a man with a sign waiting for us and it was very easy to find him. The hotel resides in an excellent location, near the major tourist attractions and many bars and restaurants. The hotel was extremely clean. The bathrooms were big and there was hot water with great water pressure in the shower. The complimentary breakfast buffet was delicious. There was a variety of fresh fruits, breads, eggs, deli meats, and other good stuff. The rooftop terrace was wonderful with breathtaking views of the water. There is free internet throughout the hotel, and the connection was very fast. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and nice. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the Sultahamet area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, thank you.”
Reviews.Author: rennie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sari Konak last month on a trip to Istanbul with my mother. The hotel was very well located and the room very comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was a particular favourite of ours. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making our stay truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: MAVCAJUN
Reviews.Content: My niece and I recently had a wonderful weeks's stay at the Hotel Sari Konak and I have already recommended it to a friend who is going to Istanbul later this year. Our room was very quiet and comfortable, a nice respite after a day of exhaustive walking and shopping! There are only a few bedrooms on each floor, and I think this adds to the quiet comfort of the hotel. The bathroom was roomy...larger than many European bathrooms in comparable-sized hotels. Nice big shower...Our towels, changed daily, smelled lovely and the towel warmer was certainly an added bonus! The breakfast buffet every morning was beautifully laid out and the food was delicious. Good, strong coffee, nice selection of cheeses and fruits and cut meats and vegetables. Hearty enough to prepare one for a day of touring. The hotel is located on a quiet street that is just a 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and the tram stop and a number of other sites. Terrific for independent travelers who want to explore on their own and then have a nice place to relax at day's end. There are also a number of very nice cafes and restaurants in the area. I've saved the best for last...the staff is remarkable. Everyone who works at the Sari Konak greets you with a smile and makes you feel as though you are a special guest. To our friends at the Front Desk: a huge "thank you" for your great restaurant tips and your interest in our Grand Bazaar finds! Your shopping advice did not go unheeded and it paid off for us! I cannot praise this hotel staff enough. They are friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. I will continue to highly recommend this hotel to my friends and would not even consider staying anywhere else when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen better!”
Reviews.Author: Aniajoe
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, enjoyed the hotel, it was the perfect choice. Our room was private, large, airconditioned but you could still open the windows for fresh air and a view. The bathroom was heated (you control) and the shower was roomy with good water pressure, and heated towel rails. The decor was traditional without being fussy, modern but warm. The Staff were very professional but friendly. We loved to breakfast, home made jams, yoghurt to die for, fresh and tasty. If the weather was better (cool and drizzly) we would have sat out in the courtyard, perfect start to the day. Don't miss a chance to go up to the roof-top terrace for a nightcap, my husband had a cognac and I had a hot chocolate (something for everyone), we had the terrace to ourselves (except for the discreet barman), view over Istanbul and the Blue Mosque, it was magical. The location was perfect, all the top sights within walking distance, and lots of restaurants to choose from for dinner, loved it completely!

Reviews.Title: “charming oasis in the midst of big city”
Reviews.Author: southerncouple43833
Reviews.Content: We just returned from seven nights at this hotel in Istanbul and were very pleased. The location is fabulous - in the midst of everything but very quiet. There was a grand breakfast to fortify us for a full day of sightseeing. The best part was returning to the hotel in the evening and going up to the rooftop before dinner to be greeted and catered to by Hasan, who was our favorite employee. We had a wonderful trip and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good in the tourist area”
Reviews.Author: Its_me_Mario
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is huge and even more huge is the tourist business in Sultanahmet area. This small hotel was quite good. During our stay they even accommodated successfully couples with kids. The rooftop bar is great and the guys working at the hotel are super. The rooms are understandably quite small and there is always some construction nearby, but that did not bother us much. Having seen the tourist sights now, next time I would probably stay at a hotel somewhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, friendly service and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: KMT_California
Reviews.Content: Saw this hotel labeled as a "find" in Frommers. What an understatement. We walked everywhere from this fabulous location, enjoyed cocktails on the rooftop terrace and slept comfortably. Though you had to pay, the shuttle to the airport offered by the hotel was extremely reasonable. Go! Go! Go!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ncoutroulis
Reviews.Content: This is a really sweet little place. It's got a great location, walking distance to the Blue Mosque, and the hotel is very well-run. We had 2 different rooms while here. The first, was nice, but small, and the second was the apartment, which was big, and really amazing. It didn't feel like a hotel, but like you'd rented a flat. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: somuch2learn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2009 and cannot stop talking about the outstanding customer service we received. From the greeting at the front desk, to the breakfast in the mornings, everything was top-notch. We asked for a recommendation for a local tour agency, and we could not have been happier with the recommended place. This is within walking distance of the major sites and you should not miss the opportunity to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A reliable oasis”
Reviews.Author: BuieKnife
Reviews.Content: We had an Istanbul hotel we used as our standby when meeting friends from overseas, but the Sari Konak is definitely replacing that. The location is superior, the service impeccable in a city of 17,000,000 plus. Our room was smallish, but certainly sufficient. It provided international channels on the TV which were nice to relax to at the end of a day of walking, the maid service was excellent, and there was a generous replacement of toiletries each morning. The beds, pillows, and duvets encouraged deep sleeping. The one minor detraction were the street side conversations outside our windows, audible before dropping off to sleep or during the day. The people at the front desk and at the breakfast buffet could not have been more helpful or attentive. We stayed for 4 nights and by the 2nd breakfast, they were bringing us our "regulars". One evening, we made a reservation at a nearby fish restaurant. The man at the front desk noticed me clutching that restaurant's brochure, so he inquired if we were dining there. He very politely warned us strongly against it and suggested another, nearby fish restaurant. That restaurant gave us a superb dinner and memorable evening. I looked up the tripadvisor.com reviews for the first restaurant. Wowser. I had never seen such bad reviews. Thank you, Sari Konak staff, for saving us from a disaster, particularly when I'm trying to see that my newly-arrived friends are not visited by the Sultan's Revenge, The Turkey Trots... Each evening, we brought bottles of vodka and tonic to the comfortable sitting area where the staff would kindly bring us glasses and ice. Whenever we had questions about how to get somewhere, what amount of time it would take, and so on, the staff gave us good information. Also, the Sari Konak is in an excellent location for popping up to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, and Topkapi Palace. There are enticing stores around the hotel - not inexpensive - but we bargained and returned with noteworthy items. The hotel is a find and lucky are those who get to stay at it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel close to Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, and tram line”
Reviews.Author: Msafiri_Hodari_Sana
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of a Turkish friend in Istanbul, I stayed at this lovely B&B for a week in January 2011. It is very conveniently located for tourist sites in the old town section (Sultanahmet) of Istanbul. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is serve-yourself from a wonderful array of options. The charges of about $100 for a single traveler were more than reasonable for the quality of the lodgings. I would plan to stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Diane B Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. It is Ideally located to walk to all the sites. The service could not have been better. Outstanding breakfast comes with the price of the room. We had a room on the top floor which was quiet and comfortable. The rooftop lounge offers great views as well as an ideal place for a light snack or cocktail. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Explore_and_Travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sari Konak is in a fantastic location. Near exceptional, restaurants, and shopping. Thebreakfast is just wonderful. Everything is fresh, tasty and a wide selection. The staff goes out of the way to make sure every need is met. Small balconies attached to the room looked over this fabulous sites Istanbul. Driving in Sultanahmet is very difficult so this hotel's location is FANTASTIC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonWilbur
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sari Konak for five nights. The location is great and it's close to transport so it's easy to explore other parts of Istanbul. The rooms are pretty and very clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Sari Konak and our time in Istanbul. Free wifi was nice to have and the breakfast was good. I would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “when we come back to istanbul it will be to stay here”
Reviews.Author: jeffandcarol
Reviews.Content: Just spent 6 great days in Isatanbul A friend told us of an area to try and stay within, we looked on the internet and found the Sari Konak - we were lucky with our choice - the hotel is perfectly placed for sight seeing, grt access to the main attractions and the tram to get further afield , yet just away from all the hustle and bustle Room we had was perfect, breakfast as substantial as you might want, roof terace fantastic though little used at this time of year by most. A few toots from taxis during the nights but not a problem - beware some hotels next to busy streets will be noisy , this is not one. Good/honest restaurants within easy walking distances - to catter for differing wallets Staff very friendly and helpfull Use a taxi from the airport if you must but once you have used the tram and the metro you will see how easy it is - and cheap ! We taxied to the hotel but trammed it back to the airport Jeff and Carol Wild

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Istanbul -- convenient, friendly, charming, comfortable ....and I could go on for ever....”
Reviews.Author: ratanr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem. It has a perfect location in Sultanahmet, walking distance from most places you want to go. The cobblestone streets around the hotel are very charming with a good sprinkling of boutique stores, tea shops, and a large selection of good restaurants all within 3 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful in anything and everything from carrying your luggage to your room at 2 in the night to providing great tips and advice on how/when to do various sightseeing/shopping agendas. The full breakfast -- very typically Turkish -- is a treat to look forward to with the smiling staff who serve it. Their selection of freshly made jams are outstanding. We stayed in room 502 -- a very charming suite! The rooftop accessible all day is a wonderful place to relax, and it also serves as a bar in the evenings. I believe breakfast is also served there in the summer. In October we were served in the wonderful indoor breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, near-perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: 1st-timer2010
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed this location, and if I get back to Istanbul I will definitely stay there again. This is a boutique hotel located an honest 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque. All old town go-to's are walking distance including Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmet Camii), the Byzantine Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar, etc. If you're used to the major international chain hotels, with large baths and counterspace, larger rooms, modern noise proofing etc, this may not be for you. But if you're looking for quaint, well located, excellent friendly and helpful staff, an unbeatable rooftop bar and patio, mellow atmosphere, and serviceable rooms, this may be for you. Full disclosure and others of note: The rooms are small but functional, bath is similar. Tended to be a little noisy with hallway and stair traffic. Rooftop bar (and we were told breakfast when weather is warmer) quickly became the evening ritual. Mellow and relaxing, a good way to decompress each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good location average hotel”
Reviews.Author: curioustraveller4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Saltunnahmet Istanbul which makes it great for walking to the sights but the rooms are average at best. They are clean but small and not pretty. The best part of this hotel is the terrace breakfast which was great. For the price we did not think this hotel was worth it and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home, very central.. Walk everywhere..”
Reviews.Author: gus9904
Reviews.Content: Overall this quaint little hotel is very well located. We arrived and quickly went upstairs to check on the terrace view which is amazing. You have the best view to the blue mosque. The rooms are nice, internet is free and the breakfast is good local food (breads, jams, cheese, yogurts, fruits, etc). Staff is pretty helpful in giving directions and suggestions. You can walk to any of the interesting historic points as well as catch the tram to head a bit farther. Plenty of nice places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cvxa
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, rooms are nice, very clean. Staff helpful and kind. I have not experienced andy problem with the noise in this hotel (unlike some other reviewers). Nice views from the roof terrace - however, there are not enough tables for breakfast for the number of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EricOlson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. The service is very good, the location is amazing, views from the roof deck are incredible and the rooms are nicely appointed and tidy. We really enjoyed our seven night stay at the Sari Konak and, if you are thinking about spending some time in Istanbul, we highly recommend it. Rooms: We stayed in room #303, which the Lonely Planet guide recommends. We concur. Our only complaint was that the mattress could have been a little newer. Keep in mind this isn't the Ritz Carlton. However, it is a nice B&B/boutique place and the pricing matches with that status. Location: If you like walking like we do (don't mind walking a couple miles here and there) then most sites and parts of the city are accessible via your own two feet. Alternatively, the clean and easy-to-use tram system is just blocks away and can take you quickly and easily to any part of the city. Cleanliness: Our room and the hotel itself were incredibly clean. We were amazed and honestly wonder how they do it. Cost: The rooms are very reasonably priced and the rates include breakfast each day. On top of that, a 10% discount is given to those who pay for their stay in cash (Turkish Lira, Euros or US Dollars).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: siouxchap
Reviews.Content: Location is great--walk to almost anywhere in old city. Staff is very friendly...speaks English well. Don't miss drinks on the roof...spectacular view at night and as well as breakfast, on the roof which was delicious, Room is spartan but clean and comfortable. Complementary computer with internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel with lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: BobHand
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel located in the center of The Sultanhamet district. Close to the tram line and the Ferry docks. Reasonable rates with a courteous and helpful staff. We occu[pied a suite shared with our son at a very reasonable rate. Full of guests all the time we were there. Graet breakfast served on the roof top terrace with great view of the Bosporus and The Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia Palace.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Sultanahmet, comfort and great staff”
Reviews.Author: LDMS
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sari Konak has an ideal location, convenient to almost all the great sites in the old part of Istanbul. Whether it's HH Sergios and Bacchos, the Blue Mosque, or Hagia Sophia, the hotel is less than ten minutes by leisurely foot. It also has a very efficient knowledgeable staff, and an exceptional sommelier for afternoon and evenings on the roof deck. It's not unjust praise to say that Hasan knows Turkish wines more thoroughly than anyone else we found and that his stock includes exceptional quality, from appertif to the great long evening finishing glass. The spacious rooms have comfort, not luxury, and the bathrooms are top class. Location, quality, value, and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Truly beautiful, a real sanctuary to come home to each day.”
Reviews.Author: parkosk
Reviews.Content: We had four nights at the Sari Konak, when Istanbul was terribly hot (36C) and humid (95%) so the air-conditioned luxury and comfort of our Suite at the Sari Konak was gorgeous. The street scene outside was engaging, though never noisy, and the location was perfect for trying local restaurants and visiting all the "must-see" tourist attractions a few minutes walk away. Coming from Sydney, we know what a good view is, but enjoying their fabulous breakfast whilst gazing almost next door to the Blue Mosque was pretty incredible. I'd highly recommend the Sari Konak - staff could not have been more helpful too. Shelley & Peter, Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: shorty181260
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location....walk to 3 main tourist attractions in 10 mins...many restaurants on the doorstep. The hotel owners are great, full of advice. ...all staff very helpful.. Room was simply furnished but spotless, wifi available ( slow ).....breakfast included was very good and the views from the terrace are to die for...night or day. Plenty of shops nearby for trinkets...bazaar at top of street tops the grand bazaar.....all the same stuff with none of the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for those looking for a small hotel experience in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: sinjin23
Reviews.Content: For those who want a small hotel experience located in the old quarter you can't go wrong with sari konak. If you want a big hotel experience you should look elsewhere. so what did i like? 1) the breakfast every morning on the roof was fabulous. the view was amazing. a good spread of yogurts, bread, cold cuts. they'll make eggs for you if you ask. non-stop coffee and tea. i must point out the gentleman who is the breakfast server for his great service and demeanor. 2) location was convenient to all the major sites. the tram is about a 10 min walk from the hotel. a few convenience stores are close by for water and misc etc. it was also a nice location to be during ramazan as there are festivities around the blue mosque area at night. 3) stayed in a deluxe double #603. very roomy and comfy. good sized bathroom. gf liked the shampoo. comfortable bed; only one slight neg was that when we showered at 11 pm there was no hot water. they claimed it was power generator for our room. so not sure if it was room specific or other rooms had problems. the hotel was only half full. 4) good a/c unit; in room safe 5) room was quiet at night 6) pleasant staff from front desk, cleaning staff, and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: bedilizia
Reviews.Content: There is little left to say about Sari Konak, as so many travellers before us have praised its service, friendly staff, cleanliness, good value and of course the outstanding location! Sultanahmet is packed with hotels and Inns, but we would definitely choose again Sari Konak because of its location, not only incredibly close to the major attractions, but at the same time quiet and pleasant. Moreover, having breakfast on the rooftop terrace with the view of the Blue Mosque is a delight! For longer stays it might be a good idea to choose a superior or a deluxe room, as the standard we had was a bit too small for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Taste of Turkish Hospitality and Service”
Reviews.Author: sirma
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel with my husband at a weekend get away...It has exceeded our expectations in great deal. The hotel is located at the heart of old city just 2 minutes walking distance from the sites . The hotel is delicately and tastefully decorated with suprising details. Every room offers a different elegant touch of Turkish culture. There is great hospitality form the staff which makes one feel at home. Do not forget to spend an evening sunset or try to catch the full moonscape hitting on the shores of the sea at the terrace which offers a great scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyHols
Reviews.Content: A really charming hotel with a wonderful roof terrace with a stunning view over the Blue Mosque. We arrived late June and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with my husband and 2 teenage sons. The main bedroom was extremely spacious with a King bed and lounge area. The second room was smaller (beds slightly too short for my tall sons) but spacious enough with its own TV. (great for us, World Cup was on!) The room also had a large foyer and very spacious, well appointed bathroom. A very nice, buffet breakfast was served on the roof terrace. All the staff were very friendly and front desk staff gave advice on restaurants and ordered taxis which arrived within minutes.The hotel is within 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia. Perfectly located for enjoying Old Istanbul on foot, with many restaurants and bars withing 5 minutes walk. I cant imagine anyone not enjoying a stay at this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: wwandrag
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel on the internet, we had certain expectations based on the Hotel's own website and a number of very positive reviews on Tripadvisor. The experience was quite in line with the most laudatory remarks and exceeded our already high expectations. The hotel is located conveniently close to the main attractions and in very close proximity to some excellent restaurants. The rooms are pleasant and, though they are not quite as spacious as would appear from the photo's on the website, comfortable and well equipped. The complimentary breakfast is quite good and caters for different tastes. It was, however, precisely the same every morning. As we stayed at the hotel for a whole week, some variation of the standard fare would have been welcome. Our room was a superior double room and had a good street view. As breakfast is served on the rooftop, one has exceptional views from there - the imposing blue mosque to the one side and the sea to the other. The street is not noisy and it was quite possible to sleep with the balcony door open. Hotel guests have free 24 hour a day access to a laptop and the internet. There is even a printer that may be used. What really distinguishes this hotel from most other good hotels we have stayed at, is the level of service from the members of the family who runs the hotel - there seems to be nothing one can request that they will not do everything possible to assist, Their friendly approach and sincere interest in the well-being of their guest are remarkable and is the main cause why we would not even consider any other hotel for future visits to Istanbul. A final general remark: Of the many places that we have been to on five continents, Istanbul itself may have been the most pleasant overall experience to date - a lot of this may be attributable to the pleasant and homely Sari Konak

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but cozy....”
Reviews.Author: Sheyno
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of the old city of Istanbul- Sultanahmet...The room is elegantly decorated, the breakfast is great...The terrace overlooking the old Istanbul is amazing..Do not leave the hotel without having a glass of wine at the terrace! Will not forget the clean soap smell in the room:) Thank you Sari Konak! Sehnaz Bulak.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: Jet18
Reviews.Content: My wife, my son and I stayed at Hotel Sari Konak during our first visit to Istanbul. Its location is superb as you can just walk around to explore Sultanahmet and its treasures. Plenty of restaurants around. The hotel feels more like a real friend's house with a great confort and service. One of the best boutique hotels I have ever experienced and furthermore, it is of great value

Reviews.Title: “A killer location, attentive service and excellent rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TravelmaniaHongKong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sari Konak last weekâ€¦we wished we had found space when we returned to Istanbul for two nights before leaving Turkey. The area is simply magic with all the main attractions just minutes on foot away. The hotel is intimate yet very detailed and comfortable. This hotel is what I wish existed everywhere I travel. A truly outstanding service with a familiar touch, the staff is welcoming and ready to suggest excellent options for her guests; they go out of their way to ensure everyoneâ€™s experience is wonderful. They call taxi and take time to ensure they know where they are going and that we have everything we need. The rooms are great, especially the suites are truly exceptionally structured little apartments with the cutest kitchenettes! They are extremely clean with excellent beds and bedding. Classic bathrooms with great showers and water pressureâ€¦.for those who travel in Turkey I can assure you is a welcome change from the overly-traditional and overly decorated B&B. Breakfast is delicious and served on the terrace with magnificent views! A great choice! Thanks Umit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly staff; gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: eturnacioglu
Reviews.Content: I had originally wanted to stay away from the very touristy Sultanahment district, but after seeing the reviews and pictures on TripAdvisor, we decided that we should try this hotel. And we were not disappointed! Mustafa was friendly from the moment we arrived, and the room itself was so cozy and perfect for the two of us. It was such a fantastic hotel to do some sightseeing around the Old City. Plus, the views from the rooftop terrace were wonderful - we were right by Sultanahmet Cami and the Ayasofya. The staff was very friendly, and we absolutely recommend this hotel. Very special memories for the two of us, newly engaged while staying at this wonderful hotel. - Erdal and Lisa

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Base for Adventure”
Reviews.Author: AngusDiver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sari Konak whilst spending a short break in Istanbul. On arrival the staff (Mustapha) was very friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable about the local area and the best way to get about and see the attractions. The rooms are very comfortable, with plenty of hot water and air-conditioning - what more could you ask for! They have a good local feel to them and are spotlessly clean. The hotel is only a short walk from the Blue Mosque and a raft of other attractions and although the area is pretty lively, this dies down around midnight ensuring you can get a good nights sleep. All the staff I encountered were excellent and the place has a family run feel to it although I don't think that it is. I would definitely stay here again when next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: heiho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2009, in deluxe room 604. It was in a perfect location, within walking distance to restaurants, shops, the Aya Sofia, and Blue Mosque. Our room was really comfortable with a huge bathroom. Breakfast was delish, make sure to try the simit and fresh squeezed OJ (OJ not included, but worth it). Staff was friendly and helpful - I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling Solo - I found my family at Sari Konak!”
Reviews.Author: pkgraysie
Reviews.Content: In addition to the excellent location, stunning views and very good breakfast on the rooftop terrace, and my comfortable, well appointed room, the highlight was the personal attention I received. Even before I arrived, the friendly staff answered my questions and not only guided me on where to hear good local jazz., but also booked a table for me. Once there they provided great directions and made it easy to book tours and performances. They go the extra mile (or km!) to ensure a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, near restaurants and tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: annafil64
Reviews.Content: We booked the suite which slept 4 people comfortably. The hotel was in a very good location within walking distance of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya . There were plenty of restaurants nearby, all eagerly trying to attract our business! There was a small bazaar within very short walking distance that was excellent for buying Turkish souveniers. The breakfast included cereal, breads, jellies, hard boiled eggs, raisins, watermelon, nuts, cheeses and meats. The hotel arranged taxi service to the airport in their private company van for 60TL. One word of warning, the hotel is very near the Blue Mosque and the morning prayers are blasted on the speakers beginning at 4:45AM and continue five times during the day, ending at 10:00PM. It added to a very interesting cultural experience! Our teenagers loved the free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arriveinstyle
Reviews.Content: It's worth paying a little extra to have a superior room in this hotel as the standard rooms are pleasant but on the small side. The roof terrace is a great place for breakfast, drinks or just relaxing and enjoying the view of the Bosphorous and the Blue Mosque. The breakfasts were very good with a selection of fruit, yoghurt, nuts, oives, cheese, bread, salamis etc and service was excellent. The hotel staff were always very pleasant and helpful but then so was everyone we met in Turkey. I agree with the comments on room 603 - we spent one night in this room and got no sleep due to noise and light from the street so be sure to ask for an upper room.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended with reservations”
Reviews.Author: zinfanatic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights. Upon arrival we were assigned the room 603. It is a subterranean room. We immediately asked to be changed since there was very little light. It was a nice room with great decor and a nice bath, but the the lack of light, underground location was not pleasant. They told us they could not change us, but" maybe would in a few nights." The first night we slept very little because it was very noisy from the street noise and we could smell the cigarette smoke from the street. Because our room was not changed for three nights, we later discovered that our windows had been left open and perhaps if we closed them we would sleep better. Well, after we closed the windows there was a dank, damp smell in the room. We believe they purposely left the window open to try to negate the smell. Our room was finally changed after staying three nights in this unpleasant room. Once we changed to a room on the second floor, we were very pleased. I think they should have changed our room more quickly since we were staying one week. They said they could not although we did talk to several couples who left their rooms permanently before we were changed. The location of the is hotel could not be beat. The terrace views were amazing and the breakfast was very good. Most of the staff was pleasant. DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 603. Rooms 501 and 502 did not seem so great either because of either a noisy location or "somewhat underground".

Reviews.Title: “Classy service at a cosy, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lexi78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sari Konak, a small 17-room hotel in Sultanahmet, during a short holiday (6 days) from work. It was perfect. The owners and staff were exceedingly friendly and obliging. It so happened that a number of friends and acquaintances were in town at the same time, so I received a number of phone calls. The gentlemen at the desk took messages for me and even helped me relay messages to my friends since I was out most of the day. They made recommendations for restaurants which were spot on. As a single woman, I felt extremely safe. As a guest, you leave your key with the hotel, so they are aware of any inconsistencies and you do not lose your key. They lock the door at midnight, which I found a bit embarrassing when I stayed out late a few times, but I also found it very reassuring. There is a young man whose job it is to stay up and let the guests in when they ring the bell. I am a germaphobe and the hotel is very clean. I would stay there again in a heartbeat, but more likely if I am traveling as a couple than as a single again. The single rooms are a bit small since it is an old, converted mansion, and the hotel is a little more expensive than I would like to pay as a single person.

Reviews.Title: “Gem near all major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Dutchtreat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for 3 nights in June. The reception people are all very nice, helpful and qualified. The room we had was very nice and roomy with a good size bathroom and well working shower. As the room was at the front of the hotel however it was noisy and we were awakened by noisy birds. The hall ways of the hotel are a bit aged and could be slightly upgraded. Breakfast is served on the rooftop from which there is a very nice view. The breakfast was good with a large variety of fruits, cheeses, meats, breads, etc etc and the coffee was good. The service is handled by 3 nice lady which are all eager to please. Over all this is a well prices hotel at a good location which can be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place !”
Reviews.Author: franmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights - could not have asked for a better place. Our room was beautiful, spacious, clean. When we walked up to the rooftop, we were amazed at the view - the Blue Mosque, the Sofia and the waterfront, Istanbul stretched out before you. The location of this small hotel is perfect, within walking distance to all sights and lots of restaurants surrounding it. The staff is great, ready to help with any requests, questions. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “TURKISH DELIGHT!”
Reviews.Author: Tangerines
Reviews.Content: Istanbul had been on our list of cities to visit for some time and we finally made it. Having found the Sari Konak on Trip Advisor we were not disappointed. The hotel is tucked away in a quiet street, but within extremely easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the local tram system Within a few minutes walk from the hotel there are a considerable number of restaurants and bars - if you are English the staff love to talk to you about football We arranged both a pick up and drop off at the airport via the hotel which was very efficient. There was no offer of assistance with our luggage which was no problem to us, however, less able travellers may need to request help as some of the rooms are not accessible via the lift The hotel has a bar on the top floor from which you can see the Blue Mosque Whilst you can hear the call to prayer quite clearly, it's just a part of the city's daily routine as you would expect to find in any major city Istanbul is a fantastic city steeped in history and well worth visiting - if you do visit the Sari Konak it's almost like visiting turkish relatives - there are a number of chain hotels here, but they will be the same as they are everywhere else, and it is nice once in a while to enjoy a more personalised experience

Reviews.Title: “Charming, delightful staff, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Gazaroochydore
Reviews.Content: A small and charming hotel that provides a warm and friendly service which was responsive without being intrusive. Very clean and well serviced rooms and facilities. A very good breakfast spread is provided. Staff will assist with restaurant recommendations, tourist advice, etc. The rooftop terrace provides stunning views of the Blue Mosque and the nearby waters.This Otel is well situated to explore the sights of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “wanted to keep this little gem to ourselves....”
Reviews.Author: crispLondon
Reviews.Content: The Srai Konak is a beautiful small hotel - boutique but still retaining its Turkish character. It is right next to the blue mosque and you can see (and hear) it from the lovely roof terrace. It is in a quiet, friendly area. The rooms are pretty and comfortable and we slept really well. We were staying at the Sari Konak when the volcano struck and the staff were absolutely brilliant. We will certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon trip”
Reviews.Author: Fiore-di-Olive-Park
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was the GREATEST! Love everything about our Stay at this Hotel in Istanbul! Everything! From the Staff, to the rooms (though ours was teeny tiny it was lovely!!!), to the Beautiful breakfast on the roof terrace, to the location. I long to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, location...quite a gem”
Reviews.Author: namila
Reviews.Content: I didn't post any pictures because the pictures posted say it all...the best thing about the hotel is the amazing roofdeck. Sitting up on the roof for breakfast or afternoon tea (they have musicians some afternoons...) is quite unbelievable. You have a perfect view of the Blue Mosque. The staff was wonderfully kind and spoke English really well and the location can't be beat. It's truly a gem. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kipellen
Reviews.Content: We had a several-day stay at the Sari Konak and were delighted with the location of the hotel (central to all major tourist attractions) and the friendliness of the hotel staff. They had recommendations for restaurants that served great food at fair prices and they also gave us assistance in prioritizing attractions so we saw the most important things. The hotel was clean and quiet (except for the loud early morning call to prayer!) and breakfast was ample and delicious. We did think the rooms were pretty small and rather basic in style, but perfectly adequate for our needs. We were pleased they had free wi-fi as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: JABAISTANBUL
Reviews.Content: The loaction of the hotel is just in the heart of old Istanbul very close to the world famous museums and mosques. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The crew always smiling and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to all who look for a great stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: regular-traveller25
Reviews.Content: Very well groomed and well located. Nice room and breakfast was excellent. Staff was helpful but seemed a bit biased on their opinions. Price was high but quality was good.

Reviews.Title: “small, stylish, intimate, clean, panoramic. a little heaven”
Reviews.Author: danielFlorence_Italy
Reviews.Content: sari konak proved as one among my best choices in last summer vacation. it's very central near sultanahmet (only drawback is not that near the tramway and furthermore you have to climb a bit to reach it), it's small enough to feel intimate, it's very elegantly furnished in a beautiful ottoman style yet with all the modern amenities one would expect from an international hotel. i visited the hotel twice, rooms proved rather small in size but perfect at the end. good bathrooms with everything functioning and in order. the breakfast during summertime is taken on the upper terrace where one can have the most stunning view over the blue mosque and hagia sophia on a side and the vastity of the sea of marmara on the other: rarely i was so distracted from my breakfast as in this hotel! and the breakfast buffet in itself is wonderful with top quality food, large choice, tipical turkish bread, great jams and preserves, tasty yoghurt, good fresh fruit juices, olives, several different cheeses and so on... the good customer service is another strong point of the sari konak: one of the receptionists for example, mr oktay, delivered us a great help in advising many things to do and see, a very efficient, friendly and pleasant person the hotel managers can be proud of. if you search grandeur, huge rooms and common spaces, large restaurants and international-hotel (non-)style go somewhere else, if you look for intimacy, coziness, small details and unforgettable views come to the sari konak

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LoveIstanbul81
Reviews.Content: Sari Konak Hotel was very intimate, clean, friendly and one of the best locations in the city. The room was very modern with a traditional Turkish decor. The staff at the desk was so helpful and the breakfast was perfect to start the day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel, friendly staff, great location - who needs anything else?”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly530
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I started off our European journey in Istanbul, and I selected the Sari Konak based on the reviews on Tripadvisor - and once again, it did not disappoint! While our room was a little small, we weren't there to stay in the room but instead were there to explore Istanbul, and the friendly staff and great location made the Sari Konak a wonderful choice.
