The front desk staff went out of their way time and again to recommend restaurants, make reservations (including requesting a table outdoors), provide maps and directions, and to tell you what you must see in a day. Not to mention the location is fantastic - we had a small balcony off our room and when you stepped out onto it, there was the Blue Mosque (one note: light sleepers should bring earplugs as the Islamic call to prayer played over the minarets is quite loud and occurs quite early in the morning!). You're walking distance to the Blue Mosque (5 minutes), Hagia Sofia (8 minutes), Topkapi Palace (15 minutes), and the Basilica Cistern (10 minutes). You're longer walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, and you're not very far from one of the metro / tram stops. The room itself was furnished nicely, the shower functioned fine, the breakfast was very enjoyable (especially eaten out on the patio - you can see in the brick walls some pipes which I believe are there from the Byzantine era), and the view from the roof top area is spectacular. Should I have the opportunity to return to Istanbul, I wouldn't hesitate to stay again at the Sari Konak!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Great Location with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: bouncingapple
Reviews.Content: For sightseeing in the Sultanahmet area, this is a great base for your adventures. We like the friendliness of the staff, the location, and the cleanliness. Having said that, we thought that for 95 euros for a standard double, there were other hotels in the area that provided comprable services for less. The breakfast was a standard turkish breakfast with local deli meats, eggs, tomatoes, cucumbers, cereal, etc. Not the highlight of the stay, but we didn't choose the hotel based on the food. The hotel provides a pickup from the airport for 25 euros, which we took, and was convenient. They also have free internet. The rooftop views are wonderful, with a picturesque view of the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel, Great Location, Staff, Rooms, Breakfast, & Value!”
Reviews.Author: American-Germany
Reviews.Content: One of the best little hotels yet! The size of the triple room was the largest we have stayed at in Europe. By the way you can fit 4 in the triple. The queen size bed is very comfy and plenty of pillows! Hair dryer, robe, and shampoo too. The staff was great, always giving great restaurants and even arranged breakfast for us early. Breakfast is the nice Mediterranean spread but here you had homemade jams. A great place to hang w/ friends too. The roof top has a view of the Blue Mosque and you can have drinks outside. We played checkers w/ our 4 year old and had a glass of wine. I also recommend you take the Havas Bus from SAW airport. Should be right outside just pay on the bus. At Taskim take a Taxi, just watch the meter. Your fair should only be 15 Lira, my husband decided not to say anything but I would have if I had known we got had!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Beltayne
Reviews.Content: A perfect position for sightseeing. Large, comfortable rooms and a lovely roof terrace with wonderful views.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: liveToTravel79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sari Konak Hotel in October this year for 4 nights and we loved it. The location was great, could walk everywhere and to the tram stop. The roof top bar was amazing with beautiful views of the city. The best part of the hotel was the extremely friendly staff. Hasan, the bartender on the roof top bar ensured we had a great time every time we visited with his witty conversations and great service. The breakfast had good variety and was delicious. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: biosfear2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel after we saw the reviews on tripadvisor, and it completely lived up to our expectations. Very clean, very friendly and helpful staff. The rooftop bar was great, lovely view of the Bosphorous and the Blue Mosque. The hotel is very conveniently located in the heart of Sultanamet, and we were able to walk to most of the well known attractions. The tram station was also pretty close. Also, they had a very good breakfast that was included in the room tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SV_London_01
Reviews.Content: Not sure can add much to the title on this. Friendly staff and great roof terrace but the breakfast isn't great. No fresh juice, some odd looking meats that NO one touched and the same stuff bought out most mornings. Otherwise OK.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and pleasant, heart of Sultanahmet but quiet, almost perfect....”
Reviews.Author: banana-republik
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, all rooms booked, took the 1 bedroom Suite #503 because of the reviews which was costly but the cash discount was nice came out to be 205 Euro/night, still pricey. But we were happy as soon as we drove up to the entrance, in the blue mosque's shadow, on a small street downhill from the bazaar, cobblestones, boutiques, small restaurants, and quiet cul-du-sac, you can picture the relaxation we felt as we entered. The morning staff person I can't remember his name, but he was great,,,quick check in, up the stairs to the suite which is separate from the regular rooms which have their own flight of stairs. Furnished in ottoman style, very clean, with kitchenette, small living room with lcd, and bedroom with simple furnishing reminding me of my grandparent's bedroom. The mood was set for visiting this historically rich and culturally vibrant city. The morning staff person was so helpful and practical and directed us to an eatery popular with locals for Kufte Kebap,,, I am still craving it after our return home. We barely spent anytime at the hotel, usually returning by midnight, with so much to do in istanbul. Breakfast is great (classic turkish): boiled eggs, 3 types of cheese, very fresh vegetables and melon, olives,,,etc, but it is the exact same breakfast everyday, so by day 4 we wanted a little change. Now the evening staff were less helpful, sent us to a very touristy restaurant (Hamdi, ok food, good view, over-priced, not one turk eating there: bad sign). Anyway, overall, great gem of a place, take a regular room for a better price unless you really like to spend a lot of time in the room, great access to the museums, mosques, aya sophia and take advice from the morning guy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in many ways”
Reviews.Author: Holidayersoldnolder
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel on our first visit to Istanbul and were extremely pleased with our choice. We often stay at, often expensive, International 'chain' hotels but were glad that we chose a 'boutique' hotel on this occasion as there were no disappointment. The location was excellent for most of the major sights and for those a little further away the tram stop was within easy walking distance. The choice of local restaurants was very good. The hotel's rooftop bar was a lovely place to relax at the end of the day - we felt that we could almost reach out and touch the Blue Mosque; a great vista in the daytime and in the evening. The breakfast area, an enclosed patio and pleasant adjoining room, was comfortable and the buffet breakfast provided a good start to the day. Our room was attractively furnished and although on the ground floor with a road outside it proved to be a quiet location. The 'discount for cash' payment option was a novel and welcome bargain. The guys on the 24 hour reception were most helpful. If we were to visit Istanbul again we would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: alexcam
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel are fantastic and when you eat breakfast on the newly constructed roof terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque, you will know you made a great choice. The rooms are very comfortable but they are not large but if you spoend too much time in your hotel whilst in Istanbul then I know where the problem is............ You can walk to all the major attractions in old Istanbul within 10 mins. In the street next to the hotel there are several excellent restaurants, the pick of the bunch being Oceans 7. Try their version of stir fry and you will return again and again and again. Back to the hotel, it cost about 80 euros per night but is worth it. The only criticism would be the price of drinks from their bar but again I would say you should not be spending time in their bar with such greatness on your door step. Btw, you get a discount if you pay in Euros. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: travel-addict2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with "travel-addict1000". I wholeheartedly agree with her review below. She arranged our stay via internet from the US and everything was perfect when we arrived. We stayed in room 602. It was spacious and lovely and I enjoyed watching the street scene from our window. We even had our own "secret stairway" up to the roof terrace, which has awesome views. It was especially amazing to be there during Ramadan and experience the call to prayer from the spectacular Blue Mosque at sundown. After a long day of exploring Istanbul, I loved coming "home" to the Sari Konak. I usually headed straight up to the roof terrace to relax with my journal and a refreshing 'bira'. Hasan (the bartender) is very attentive and he has a wealth of knowledge about Turkey and its culture. We had some great conversations. Only one word of caution: beware of the marble stairs - especially if you are wearing flip flops!

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: travel-addict1000
Reviews.Content: I've traveled a lot around the world and the Hotel Sari Konak is one of my favorite hotels of all time. The service was fanastic, the location was in a safe and convenient location and the staff was friendly and helpful. The roof top terrace is beautiful. I spent hours sitting on the terrace with a Efes Bria (Turkish beer) watching the sun go down behind the Blue Mosque. You can even see the Bosphorus from the terrace. It's unbelievable! As a single woman I felt very safe here. The staff--Oktay, Hasan, Mustafa, Ester, Yeter, Nurgul, Naciye, Serdar....... were gracious, willing to help, happy to be of service and professional. They had smiles on their faces everyday and made sure I was comfortable and had everything I needed to have an wonderful experience (I've never stayed in a hotel with such caring staff). There were many cafes around the corner and all the major sites were within a half mile. The room was beautiful and the bed was extremely comfortable (it's worth spending the extra money on a delux room, they're more roomy than the standard rooms). There is no restaurant, but there is bar service on the roof top terrance between 3:00-10:00. I didn't miss having a restaurant in the hotel because there are dozens of places to eat just outside the front door. When I travel I look for non-Hyatt/Hilton type hotels because I want to get closer to experiencing the country I'm in. If you want an American experience stay in an American hotel (personally I don't need a fitness room, buiness center and room service). If you want a smaller and locally owned hotel this is the place for you. This is a charming hotel. The staff make it a truly wonderful experience. NOTE: The photos on their web site are very accurate. I love that they give you photos of each room as well as the public spaces. There is only one computer so if you need to spend a lot of time on e-mail you should bring your own computer (sending e-mails from the roof top terrace with an Efes in you hand is the way to go--it's a little bit of heaven).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Carrie1961
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great - just behind the Blue Mosque. The staff were friendly and pointed out things we could do indoors as on our arrival it was pouring rain. Our room was small but plesantly furnished. There are numerous resturants and bars nearby. Free internet was also provided. My only regret was that we were there in winter and can't take advantage of roof terrace. I have recommended this hotel to others who have visited Istanbul since our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: Canadinn_Travelbug_
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The location was amazing, close to all the sights (walking distance) but still on a quiet side street of Sultanhamet. We had a room facing this street with a little balcony and at night there was absolute silence, save for the call to prayer of course. The room was very comfortable and incredibly clean. It was on the small side but this is Istanbul. The towels were nice and fluffy. The staff were also incredible and there was a nice mix of guests staying here from all countries. The rooftop terrace is beyond words.... view of the Blue Mosque and Hagha Sofia and the Marmara sea. The place was not very busy and we would often have the terrace to ourselves. I really enjoyed the breakfasts on the rooftop and the food was excellent. I looked around when we were having the breakfast and I noticed that there was hardly any other guests having breakfasts on the other roof terraces in the neigbourhood, while our terrace was always full. It really says something about a hotel when even in a recession it stays relatively full compared to other hotels in the area. I did note a significant drop in tourism in Sultanhamet. We walked in to the major sights any time of day with no line ups and I never noted major crowds and we were there in August. The guidebook said to go early to the Hagia Sofia, but this was not at all necessary. It really was wonderful. I would highly recommend the Sari Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley hotel but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: minsky007
Reviews.Content: Visited Istanbul in May 2009. May is the best time for visiting Istanbul - weather is just right. The hotel is a family owned business. So, the front line staff at reception are very polite, friendly, and very helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel exchanges foreign currency and gives a better rate then the local exchange bureaus. This was a real surprise - usually hotels are the worst place for changing currency (in terms of exchange rates). Hotel has been modernised to a very high standard. I booked Suite 305. This was spacious, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast in the morning is plentiful but if you want freshly squeezed orange juice then there is an extra charge for it (4 Euros)! I was a little disappointed at this as this is not a cheap hotel to stay in. The hotel is less than ten minutes walk to all main local tourist attractions - Blue Mosque, Saint Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Gulhane Park. The hotel is very close to the tram. It is very cheap and easy to use. Use it and save on taxi fares! Overall, we all enjoyed our stay at the hotel. I had booked this hotel as a special treat for my 72 year old mother. The hotel was slightly on the pricey side but worth it. Would I stay at this hotel again? Probably not. Although a lovely hotel it is slightly overpriced - there is no gym or swimming pool. Review by: Minaz, London (England, UK)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: memphismom0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cozy and pretty. Very very clean rooms and excellent service. Such a great bargain with the fantastic breakfast on the rooftop terrace. We loved Istanbul and our hotel. If you are staying in Sultanahmet, stay here. You can walk to all the sights. Have the hotel arrange for a personal guide and your hotel transfers. So convenient. But book early, this is not a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in wonderful location with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sara0709
Reviews.Content: We spent a delightful week in Istanbul which was made all the more enjoyable by the friendly and helpful staff at the Sari Konak. As an example, when we arrived around midnight and asked the receptionist where we might be able to change some money, he indicated that no banks were open at that time but, to our great surprise, he offered us some Turkish Lira so we could go to a local convenience store to buy some food. What a way to build trust! "Don't worry, he said. Just pay us back when you get a chance to change money." They always treated us like family. Our room was clean and tidy but smaller than appeared on the hotel web site. We had a room facing the street which was a little noisy at times (e.g. 2am garbage pickups) but not unbearable. There was nothing much we could do about the round the clock call to prayers but I have to admit that I missed them after we left Istanbul. The rooftop breakfasts with panoramic views of the Sea of Marmara and breathtaking views of the Blue Mosque were the highlight of our stay. We got to know the local seagulls on a first-name basis and they, in turn, kept at a respectful distance while eyeing our delicious morning repast with positive anticipation. All the staff, without exception, were always available to help make our stay as comfortable and memorable as possible. We will remember this hotel fondly and very much look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with wonderful rooftop terrace view of Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerRPW
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Sari Konak on the recommendation of a friend who had stayed there a year before. We were so pleased! It was a lovely base for our first visit to Turkey. Nice, clean rooms. Friendly staff. Great location in old part of city, walking distance to major sights. But the real treat is the rooftop terrace. Facing the Sea of Marmara, you can turn and see both the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia. Friendly Hasa serves drinks and share details of the city he grew up in as the afternoon fades into a gloriously soft and gentle ocean kissed evening. the lights across the sea on the Asian side of Istanbul begin to sparkle as ships of all sizes cruise past and the sounds of Turkish music from nearby restaurants wash over you. The mornings are equally lovely. Simple, delicious breakfast buffet and coffee served by Esme and others. We had clear, sunny days until our last when we woke to a sky full of stormy looking clouds, backlit by silver sunshine. An amazing view over the sea and behind the Mosque. Start and end each day on that terrace and you will be sure to have a wonderful time in Istanbul. Thanks to Mustafa and Oktay for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly hotel near most of the major tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: alex6551
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in the first week in August. Its location was great being close to the main attractions (blue mosque, ayia sofia, grand bazar (via tram-two stops), and port for ferries). The hotel was very clean and the staff were all very friendly and helpful- especially on reeption. The terrace (used for breakfasts and as a bar for the rest of the day) was very scenic with the blue mosque and ayia sofia directly behind). Other reviewers have said that the breakfast was great, but for the price I would say that the breakfast was the only thing that let it down- there was not a lot of choice and found out that they charged for orange juice (although it was fresh)- however I do not want to over complain about this as food in turkey is always to a decent standard- although with a little effort they could improve on the brekkie. The rooms were very clean and the beds/linen etc all good. I would definitely reccommend this hotel for the fact that its location makes a great base to explore Istanbul. We were first timers to the place however it was not hard to spot that the restaurants around the direct vicinity of the hotel were not as good as those outside of sultanahmet- however prices are not that expensive generally. Whilst on topic, I would definitely There are loads of hotels around this hotel and I am sure that they are all just as good. The only thing I would say about these hotels is that they are period properties and therefore anyone that has difficulties with stairs probably should make sure they get a room next to the elevator (old style) as there are lots of landings and half landings which require going up and down steps. Overall a great hotel and would reccommend to anyone. 4.5 out of 5 (only the brekfast letting it down). Alex & Tina

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with good friends”
Reviews.Author: Willie2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of February with my wife and teenage son. It was a very very nice experience. I won't repeat all the other good reviews but I would like to mention Oktay and Mustafa who were so nice and always helpful. I looked forward to coming back to the hotel after each outing as they always asked how we got on etc. Oktay even managed to steer my wife to a fantastic place where she could buy material for currtains, pillowcases etc.,where there were absolutely no tourists. She was in heaven and delighted. This is how a hotel should be run.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul's old quarter”
Reviews.Author: lomalAucklandNZ
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this small hotel in wonderful Istanbul. The room was kept clean and fresh, the breakfasts were delightful and the location great. Situated in Sultanahmet - the old quarter with it's cobbled streets, it was just a stroll away from a variety of good restaurants and also the main attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Sophia etc. From the Sophia a short tram ride to the Grand Bazaar. It was the helpful and friendly staff who made our stay so enjoyable. Couldn't fault this Hotel for value and comfort. They even welcomed our friends who came looking for us one day with a cup of tea until we returned from shopping. L & M Macaskill Auckland NZ

Reviews.Title: “WARM HOSPITALITY IN CHARMING OTTOMAN MANSION”
Reviews.Author: texanandturk
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, Sari Konak is my home away from home when I am visiting Istanbul. Managed by brothers Murat and Umit Okan, the friendly and unobtrusive staff exemplify the inherent hospitality of the Turkish people. Tucked away on a small street, the beautifully restored Ottoman mansion is strategically located in the heart of Sultanahmet, just a short walk from dozens of key historic landmarks. When I return to Sari Konak after a busy day of sightseeing and shopping, the cozy atmosphere offers a quiet refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city. Subtly showcasing the arts and handicrafts of Turkey, the interior decoration transports the guest to another time. And few rooftop views can rival this charming hotelâ€™s panorama of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. But for me, the exquisite garden with its archeological artifacts, trickling fountain, and beautiful flowers may be one of the best features of Sari Konak. Nestled within a tall stone wall, this retreat presents a wonderful ambience for a savory Turkish breakfast or an afternoon cup of tea. Time after time, I return to Sari Konakâ€”and always willâ€”because the hotel provides soothing comfort to reinvigorate the weary traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for an Istanbul stay that was welcoming, comfortable, clean and charming.”
Reviews.Author: News4you
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a boutique hotel. My wife and I spent a week here at the conclusion of a recent cruise. Its' location couldn't be better as it sits on a lovely street in the Sultanamet district less than a five minute walk from the major sites (Blue Mosque, Haga Sofia, Toipkapi, Cisterns, Hippodrome etc) and the marvelous Istanbul tram system. The rooms are beautifully decorated with large bathrooms, effective air conditioning and comfortable beds. The complementary breakfast was delicious and a perfect time to hear stories from the owner about the ancient palace wall that is part of the courtyard or share tips with fellow guests. The rooftop terrace bar has just finished a major redo with new furniture and awnings. And here is where you will find the really special part of the Sari Konak....the breath taking view from here. To one side is the Blue Mosque set against the sky at sunset and so close you think you can touch it. To the other is the Bosporus with Asia glittering in the background. A drink here at the end of the day is our most treasured memory. The neighborhood is filled with wonderful restaurants...especially the fish house up on the corner with live music and fantastic food. There is good shopping right in the area and especially the small bazaar just below the Blue Mosque with better than normal quality goods. The owners and their amazing staff are the best part of the hotel...their willingness to share their knowledge of this great city, helpfulness in dealing with problems big and small like lost cab drivers and the warm hospitality made for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “wish we had stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: ayrshirelass
Reviews.Content: We did not stay in this hotel when we were in Istanbul in june,but found it when we were wandering around the area,The outside looked so appealing that we popped in to have a look, and the man at the desk could not have been more helpful. We went up to the roof terrace and the views are outstanding. Obviously we did not look in the rooms, but the public areas were beautiful,well kept and gleaming, but the staff seemed to have such pride in their hotel that I really do wish we had stayed there.The immediate area is so lovely too,convenient for all the sights,plenty of bars and restaurantsnearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, superb value.”
Reviews.Author: Papoujim
Reviews.Content: Could not do better in location and service. The staff is friendly and actually happy to see you as a guest rather than a customer. Rooms clean and very good baths. The location is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia, Cistern, tour buses, etc. The rooftop bar has a wonderful view of Istanbul and especially the Blue Mosque at night.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Thaibean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for 3 nights on a last minute weekend trip to Istanbul and it was perfect. On arrival we were told we had been upgraded - a lovely surprise! Our room was lovely - nicely decorated, fresh and very clean with a really comfortable bed. The staff were helpful and friendly - great yet unobtrusive service. When we arrived we were given a map and shown where we were and where the main sites were in relation - fabulous as we didn't take a map or guidebook with us. I thought that was a really nice touch as these weren't free tourist maps, we really appreciated it and found it useful. It was a great place to stay for sightseeing as it is near the main sights in Sultanahmet - the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and it is very easy to get the tram from there which is the best choice we found for getting around to see other parts of Istanbul. There is a fantastic roof terrace with a fabulous view of the Blue Mosque but also a great view out to sea - a wonderful place to sit and relax with a drink at the end of the day. The whole hotel is very well thought out and comfortable. We did find things a lot more expensive in Istanbul than we thought - we can eat Turkish food out for the same prices or less in Central London than we could eat around Sultanahmet. Maybe it is just the weak GBP or that we are more used to travelling in SE Asia!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Marc117
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul, and the Sari Konak had everything we were looking for in a hotel -- and at a reasonable price. Our room (303) was clean, comfortable, and attractively decorated with Turkish rugs, lattice windows in a bay overlooking the street, and Ottoman-style furnishings. The bathroom was spotless and had a convenient tub/shower. The breakfasts of fruit, yogurt, cereal, meats, cheeses, and breads were fresh, healthy, and substantial enough that we usually skipped lunch. The hotel's location is between the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya and about a 5-minute walk from the main tram line that connects to Karakoy, Eminomu, and other areas a tourist is likely to want to visit. The hotel's relatively small size (17 rooms) gave it a quiet, cozy feel that was extremely relaxing. Finally, a computer with free internet access and a printer for guests made it convenient to check emails without going through all the hassles (and extra fees) I've encountered at many "high end" hotels in the States. (Also, I didn't need to pack a laptop.) In short, the Sari Konak satisfied all our needs in a hotel. The two best features of the hotel, however, were the friendly staff and the rooftop terrace. The Okun family, along with Mustafa and Oktay at reception, and Hasan on the terrace, really made us feel welcome and were extremely helpful with restaurant suggestions and other arrangements. The rooftop terrace offered amazing views of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, and the sea. One of the highlights of our trip was the chance to sit on the terrace and enjoy a drink at the end of the day, watching ships entering and leaving the Bosphorus, listening to the call to prayer from the Blue Mosque, and chatting with Hasan and with other guests. We can't wait to go back! One small practical suggestion: plan ahead to pay your bill in cash, in view of the 10% discount offered by the hotel for cash payments. Since most banks impose a limit on daily ATM withdrawals, that either means taking out extra amounts for several days before you leave (which you can accumulate in your room safe), or having the foresight to call your bank to raise your limit before you go on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogerjm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Sari Konak, arriving at 11:30 pm the first night, due to a late flight. Our pick up at the airport was perfect, and was a precursor of the rest of our stay at the hotel. The room was clean, comfortable and very well maintained. Our breakfasts were great, with fresh fruits, meats, breads and cereals. The staff was perfect. We had drinks on their rooftop bar on two nights and it was a delight with views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. The location is very convenient to the sights of Istanbul and loads of restaurants. Most importantly, all of the staff at the Sara Konak are to be complimented. They provide a service to the traveller, which is very much appreciated. You can not do better in Istanbul. i would stay there any tiime.

Reviews.Title: “superb b&b in the historic district with an extremely caring staff”
Reviews.Author: retiredprof17
Reviews.Content: After reading almost every piece of available information on the internet and in guide books, we decided to spend our first 6 days in Turkey at the Sari Konak in Sultanahmet. It exceeded our expectations. The location was wonderful. We walked to almost all the top sights, e.g., Topkapi, Ayasofya. Both the room and breakfast were quite good. Best of all were the staff. They were very helpful, knowledgeable, extremely caring and kind. We think part of the success of Sari Konak is the direct in-person presence of the owning Okun family. They are visible, friendly and personally involved. A tip of the hat to the staff, Sergun, Oktay, Serdar, and Eser for all they did to help make our stay so great. All of this for only $135, in one of their best rooms, after the cash discount. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace and elegance in the very heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JackieHughes
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, the staff are increadibly friendly and went go to great lengths to be helpful. Stayed 5 nights and breakfast was consistenely fresh, daily. It's a short stroll to The Blue Mosque etc. etc. I will definitely stay there next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: JudyEdinbrgh
Reviews.Content: Oasis of calm and ottoman comfort in magical but busy city.Traditional bedroom (303) with window seat and view upand down street - comfortable and everything working in bathroom. Fine roof top area (once current upgrading iscompleted) with fine views to Sea of Marmara and in the other direction Sulanahmed mosque and Hagia Sohpia. Nice breakfast area with same buffet daily which was pleasant if a little limited- outside courtyard seating - and also lounge area with ottoman divans. Helpful friendly staff. Good location for main sights and tram line Charming place to come back to and we also slept well here with plenty fresh air from several wndows and not much street noise.One of our better city break hotels. Good restaurants short walk away. Judy & Scott Edinburgh

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: brandybob
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Sari Konak. Booked it solely based on Trip Advisor reviews, so it was good to see that they accurately reflected this delightful small hotel. Took a pre-booked mini-bus after our Easyjet flight (be warned that Sabiha Gokchen airport is a good hour away from Sultanhamet and public transport from there is minimal). A warm welcome at the hotel and our luggage was carried up to our room - 604 - a large deluxe at the top of the stairs, which was very secluded and quiet - no other rooms nearby. Very clean, spacious - worth the extra money. Huge firm bed, flatscreen TV, comfy chairs, large bathroom with heated floor and rainforest shower. Room spotlessly clean (and I'm fussy...), and housekeeping very good throughout stay. Hotel in a great position about 3 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and 5 mins walk to Sultanhamet tram stop (we used the trams and ferries to get everywhere - only 1.40 TYL a journey). Numerous restaurants in the immediate area (the Metropolis cafe/restaurant just around the corner from the hotel was superb), along with more just off the main street near the tram stop. Staff very friendly, always welcoming us back and happy to talk. Mustafa especially is attentive and chatty. Criticisms would be the fact that the room had no information in it whatsoever - no folder, nothing about the hotel / minibar charges / surrounding area etc, nothing about fire exits... nothing! Also the roof terrace was being developed and although we could sit out it was a mess - given that it was the end of April and the weather was sunny we were surprised by this. Lastly the breakfast was a little bit samey four days in a row - a bit more variety would have been nice, and charging 4 TYL for fresh orange juice was a bit cheeky (tea, coffee, water and squash were the only options). Overall very good though, and if they addressed the minor niggles it would be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for its size and style”
Reviews.Author: GGGGGGGGGGGGGGX
Reviews.Content: This is a small, immaculate, entirely user-friendly place, right in the heart of the Sultanahmet, which is where you want to be--as long as you can deal with the 5:45 a.m. call to prayer, which can't be tuned out here, as location is a few hundred yards from the Blue Mosque. But, then, the view of the Mosque from your balcony is perfect. The staff speaks excellent English and is always ready to assist with directions, dinner reservations, and the like. Can't think of anything that needs improving.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but maybe not ****”
Reviews.Author: SwedenPer
Reviews.Content: Listen, this IS a good hotel but I would not rate it as a four star hotel. The staff is what makes it an exceptional hotel but to be a four star hotel I personally think that you need to have at least a hotel bar. - Reception was very good and so was the staff... - Location excellent for a weekend visit as it is close to many historical/cultural places and loads of restaurants and bars nearby. - Breakfast was very good and so was the staff... - Depature was excellent ! We spent the very last minutes on a restaurant close to the hotel and the staff was became troubled about us not making it to the airport. They actually called us up on the restaurant to warn us and to speed up the service ! We had totally lost track of time so without this we would have missed our flight. Istanbul overall was a pleasant suprise and we will go back and we will probably stay on the same hotel. Next time it will be without our 8mths daughter but I must say that we was very much welcome with a small child everywhere ! Rated from the reception on all places we went to, this is probably one of the best cities in Europe to go with small children !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, good breakfast, beautiful room, great location”
Reviews.Author: RunwitSnowman
Reviews.Content: We stopped in this hotel for 6 nights and can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. The location is great for visiting Istanbul's major tourist attractions, handy for public transport with restaurants and bars in surounding streets, Our room was very pretty, warm and had a bath. The hotel was a senstively restored building with interesting period features. The breakfast buffet was good. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a true find”
Reviews.Author: Travelleralways2
Reviews.Content: this hotel is delightful, wonderful rooms, excelletnt location and very ncie atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bikesub
Reviews.Content: This cozy hotel has an excellent location just metres away from Blue Mosque. Easy to get walking to everywhere. Not too fancy but clean and more than reasonable for the price. Book a superior room, they are just the size you may need, not as big as in the website photos though. Breakfast is nothing spectacular but does the job. Nice and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, Exquisite and Exceptionally a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: klam
Reviews.Content: Booked this through expedia.com based on reviews. We got it for a fabulous price and flew in from Sabiha Gokcen Airport. Booked a shuttle to the hotel through http://www.istanbulairportshuttle.com/ for only 10 euros each person. Hotel arrival was smooth. Stayed Feb 13- 15 in room 104. Small room but definately appreciated the cleanliness, and quality of the washroom. GREAT Shower and bed, very comfortable. Loved the heated towels, it was a nice touch. Maid service was perfect, not only did a great job on the room but also a great job on my boyfriends clothes and things spralled all over the room. We came back to a very neat and tidy place. Noise was minimal and breakfast was a good turkish spread. Mustafa was very kind and so was the older gentlemen we met each morning. Amazing customer service, cannot say enough about our stay. Distance to tourist spots is impeccable. walked everywhere including to Grand Bazaar. Would recommend remember your hotel location as some taxis are unclear of where hotel is located. Hotel is behind blue mosque near small bazaar. Bring a hotel card with you. Conclusively, would never ever trade this hotel in for anything more expensive. Impeccable and PERFECT~!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: earlybird22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sari Konak for several days in December after chosing the hotel based on reviews from this website. Upon our arrival at the hotel, I knew we'd made the right choice. We had arranged for a driver from the hotel to meet us at the airport and even though our flight arrived quite late the driver was there. We spoke with other travelers later who did not have a prearranged ride to their hotels and they felt they'd considerably overpaid for their transportation. From the moment we walked in the door, reception made us feel welcome. We stayed in room 204, the basic double room. The room itself was small but very comfortable -- nice wooden floors and light colors gave it a warm feeling. The bathroom was a nice size and the shower was divine -- excellent water pressure and tempertature. The room and bathroom were very clean and well kept. Be sure to take an alarm clock -- there wasn't one in our room although our wake up calls never failed! We'd brought our laptop and wireless service from our room was spotty, but we had a great connection from the sitting room downstairs and it was a very comfortable area to do emailing, etc. From our patio to the right we could see the Blue Mosque clearly. Although the rooftop terrace was closed during our stay (offseason), we were permitted to visit the terrace and enjoy the view. In the summer months this terrace would be spectacular. Although the breakfast buffet menu did not vary during our stay, the selection was great. I was able to try something new each morning. I especially liked the yogurt with all sorts of toppings available (nuts, granola, jams, apricots, figs, etc)The coffee was very good and plentiful. At our request, reception arranged various tours for us and were able to accomodate our often last minute requests for the Dervish show, Bosphorous cruise, Turkish bath, and other things. They were extremely helpful. We found one guide, a woman named Ozgu, especially vibrant and informative. The hotel arranged our tours with her company and we were fortunate enough to have Ozgu as our guide for all three of our half day tours. The only downside to one of the half day tours was the "carpet demonstration" that turned out to be a rather aggressive sales pitch. I would rather have spent more time at one of the museums. Our other tours with the same company did not include this. We also had our best meal at the recommendation of the hotel at Hamdi Restaurant near the Spice Market. Excellent food , unparalleled view and quite reasonably priced. This hotel is ideally situated for tourists to explore the city. With the exception of our trip to the airport, we never needed a cab! We reached the Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Whirling Dervish show, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and numerous decent restaurants all on foot. The weather is December was variable: we were fortunate to have several days of sun but there were some rainy days, too. I would visit off season again in a heartbeat due to the complete lack of crowds and lines. A great stay at Sari Konak in Istanbul --thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have made a better hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: dhmc
Reviews.Content: In choosing the hotel for our week-long Christmas vacation in Istanbul, I had to sidestep the suggestions of our travel agent, who insisted that we would be unhappy if we chose a small boutique hotel. I used Trip Advisor and several other websites to narrow the field, settling on the Sari Konak because of its good reviews. What a great choice we made! Not only was the location perfect for sightseeing, shopping, dining, and experiencing local charm, but the staff was exceptional. We booked two rooms, one for our grown children (a standard room which was small, but adequate) and a deluxe room for ourselves. While we had to navigate two flights of narrow stairs to reach our room (#604), it was the only room on that floor, so we had complete privacy, with windows looking over the quiet street behind the hotel. Very spacious, with a king size bed and three large easy chairs, our family gathered comfortably in our room when the weather kept us indoors. The bathroom was state of the art modern, with lots of hot water and lovely soaps to take the chill out of the dreary days. Even the towels smelled wonderful! We would meet for breakfast in the mornings...a nutricious and colorful spread awaited us in the dining room. The coffee was delicious, and the selection of foods was satisfying for everyone in the family, even our picky eaters. If we needed help with our daily excursions, the staff was more than willing to give us directions, guidance, and advice. It was wonderful to know that our hotel was so close to most of the major sights that we could return to the hotel to go to the bathroom, rest our feet, or get warm. Our room was always immaculately made up when we returned, and we never had to wait for the maids to service our rooms, as happens in American hotels. With only a small staff, they manage to keep the hotel spotlessly clean, and every employee takes pride in running a quality establishment. In short, the Sari Konak is a delightful place to lay your head. I'm sure there are other lovely places to stay, but you will not go wrong if you choose the Sari Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and fantastic locaton”
Reviews.Author: TallmanBirmingham_UK
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay in Istanbul. The hotel staff were very welcoming and pleasant and provided us with all the information we needed.The rooms were very comfortable and the en suite facilites were excellent. The main attraction however was the lovely roof terrace with fantastic views of the Blue Mosque and surrounding area. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was the highlight”
Reviews.Author: mbw1
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in Istanbul in December. The weather was cold, damp and dreary. It was a holiday week so many attractions were closed. However, the Sari Konek was a delight. Our room was newly refurbished and spacious (for the price). I don't usually like breakfast buffets, but the breakfast buffet at the Sari Konekwas fresh and delicious. I did not get an email after our stay asking me to write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Welcome !”
Reviews.Author: LillebethGuildford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak the last week in November 2008. We used the taxi ,organised by the hotel, from the airport and found that both convenient and good value for money as on our returtn we payed slightly more as per the meter. We had a great welcome with lots of useful information given to us by the receptionist. Our room, towards the back, was not big but recently refurbished and with a great view of The Blue Mosque. The breakfast buffee was superb! We recommend the hotel whole heartedly and also going to Istanbul in November as, although it wasn't warm, there are hardly any tourists around and you have the place to yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, exemplary service”
Reviews.Author: iowacorn
Reviews.Content: We (3 of us) stayed at the Sari Konak in late November. We had a wonderful stay in the triple room (room 105). There was actually room enough for 4. There was plenty of space for our baggage as well. The windows opened out to the patio area and afforded a view of the Blue Mosque through trees. The bathroom was small but adequate. Special mention goes to the rain shower head. With the unending supply of hot water and the nice shower head, it made it hard to take short showers. Breakfast was good. Everything was fresh and had good variety. The staff at breakfast were attentive and thoughtful. After the first morning, they remembered all our breakfast drinks of choice. The front desk (Mustafa and Oktay) were very welcoming and helpful. We needed a transformer for our camera charger and Oktay pulled out several different options for us to try. They also had a computer with free internet access so we could check email, etc.. The location was very convenient. Taxis were always readily available and the Sultanahmet sights were only a few minutes walk away. While the hotel itself was very nice, it was the service that made the stay most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint family run hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: MadeInCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Hotel Sari Konak! You feel like one of the family when you stay at the this hotel and they treat you like one too. The only place we would stay in Istanbul is at the Sari Konak. The hotel is located right in the heart of Sultanhament within easy walking distance to major attractions. The neighborhood is a quiet escape just outside the buzz. It is filled with charming houses and old world charm. Besides the great location, the hotel and staff were wonderful. We wanted the small hotel experience and personalized service and we definately got it. What impressed us the most was that the hotel staff took a genuine interest in our stay. They are very knowledgable about the city and gave great advice on everything from restaurants and attractions to what to watch out for. The rooms are decorated in a simple European style but they were clean and quaint and the bathroom was remodelled and modern. There is also a great rooftop terrace with a bar and views of the Blue Mosque and Bosphorous. This was a great place to meet other guests and relax after a busy day. The breakfast room is tastefully decorated in traditional style. The service was attentive and personal and the quality of the breakfast amenities was great. This hotel has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ebit
Reviews.Content: As Public Enemy famously sang: Donâ€™t Believe the Hype. We were sent an email by the hotel asking us to review our experience there which may explain the glut of reviews for it on this site. We really thought the Sari Konak was an overrated experience from start to finish and did not represent great value for the amount we paid. We kicked off our time there with an overpriced airport transfer, were given a tiny room with an old tv that didnâ€™t work and a worn out bathroom (they were renovating other rooms at the hotel during our stay, hopefully ours was next) and were then told, that despite booking our stay through an online booking service using a credit card, we were required to settle our bill in cash. We asked for a dinner recommendation, and were given a card for a nearby tourist trap (with strict instructions that we MUST tell the waiter who had sent us) and the food was the worst we ate in our 2 weeks in Turkey. Still, none of that annoyed us as much as being told that, when we needed to leave the place by 7am our final morning, we would not be receiving the much hyped breakfast included in our price. Other places that we have stayed in that have billed themselves as similar, boutique-style accommodation, have been flexible, accommodating and have usually bent over backwards to make sure some arrangement for early breakfast or coffee â€“ however basic or simple â€“ is come to. We think this is a demonstration of the fact that this place, while more than adequate as a hotel for a few nights, really isnâ€™t what it bills itself as. Perhaps it once was different, judging from other reviews? Despite the stunning close up view of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop terrace, you can probably do better in Sultanahmet for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RolfeTeddington
Reviews.Content: Visited the Sari Konak with my wife from the 5-11th Sept. There were a number of problems with our itinerary after this stay and the staff spent a lot of time and effort in getting matters sorted out. The hotel is in a good location and has a fantastic view from the roof terrace of both the Blue Mosque and a panoramic vista of all the ships waiting to go into the Bosphorus. The room we had was a good size, clean and the beds were comfortable. As there is a quite a bit of noise in this district at night taking ear plugs would probably be a good idea. The staff were most helpful during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Elmo999
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for a long weekend here and had a really great time. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and friendly. Their recommendations for restaurants proved excellent and general advice about our stay and how to make the most of our time valuable. Our rooms were exactly what we needed after a hard day's sightseeing. We were in standard rooms, so not huge, but a large bathroom with excellent shower and a very comfy bed. Ours also had a small balcony with a great view of the blue mosque. Fantastic views from the roof as well (and scrabble provided if you felt the urge), even though a little windy and cold on our weekend. All in all, we felt comfortable, relaxed and looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: German_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Based on the rave reviews found here, we booked a 4-night stay at the Sari Konak mid-October, pre-booking Suite 305 for the extra space. That was the first dissapointment - based on the (no longer available photos) on the website, I expected a large room with an en-suite sitting area. In actual fact, both rooms (no door between, just a curtain) each had 2 beds and the sofa was alongside the double bed. So it would have been perfect for 4 adults or parents with 2 kids, but it wasn't the romantic bed-/sitting-room I had expected for the 2 of us. The bathroom was also dissapointing. The bath itself had a jacuzzi function, but the water jets looked so grimey, that we didn't dare use them. The ceiling had water stains and peeling paint, making the otherwise decent-sized bathroom not much fun to spend much time in. The beds were good, but the windows not very sound-proof. You'll get the 5 a.m. Muezzin wake-up call everywhere in Istanbul, but even with closed windows it had us sitting upright in bed every morning. The staff were indeed very friendly, but there was one major dissapointment when we couldn't be seated for breakfast one morning. All tables were taken and there seemed no possibility to add one. The only options offered were to sit outside (not tempting at 15 C) or to wait. No apologies offered. Frustrated, we left the hotel and had breakfast elsewhere, deducting the cost from our final bill. Which was taken with much ill grace. The posivites are definitely the location, absolutely unbeatable for the main historic sites, and the terrace with great views. Only downside with the terrace was the building work going on, with plastic and rubbish lying around. All in all: I wouldn't go there again, there are similarly priced and good-value hotels that are also well-rated here, which I would prefer to try.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul in October - this hotel was the perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: aggiesplace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for 4 nights and couldn't have been more delighted. Our suite (#305) was huge (would have slept up to 5 people if needed!), and very comfortable - with a wonderful view of the Blue Mosque from the window. The ambiance of the hotel was fabulous - it's an Istanbul mansion that has been gorgeously restored. The location simply can't be beat - everything in the Sultanahmet district is in easy walking distance. And most importantly, everyone we met who worked there was as friendly and helpful as you can imagine. This place really is a gem. By the way, we also found an excellent guide who met us each morning at the hotel - his name is Mehmet Tetik. Very knowledgeable and personable, and really took the time to understand what things were most important to us. You can get more information and contact him via this link: http://www.turkeytravelplanner.com/guides/tetik_m.html

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful gem hidden away in Sultanahmed”
Reviews.Author: kaydeedee
Reviews.Content: We so much enjoyed our stay in October 2008 at your hotel. Your location so close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi is superb. You are within walking distance of some of Istanbul's key attractions. We toured Istanbul from this convenient location in all direction, including the street car out to Kabatas. Another convenience in exploring Istanbul. The weather was perfect for late October with 21 degrees and sun for almost all of the time. The little restaurants all around you are so very nice too. We particularly enjoyed your roof terrace and the absolutely incredible view from it of the Blue Mosque on one side and the Bosporus on the other. We also want to commend your attractive breakfast room and the breakfast selection you offer. Your attentive staff, the helpful front-desk and attractive room all count as part of our enjoyable visit. We will recommend you to our friends for their visits to Istanbul. You are truly a hidden gem in the beautiful Sultanahmed district!!!! Regina and Klaus Doose, Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Special weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: K1W115
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here for a special surprise weekend.We stayed for 3 nights in Suite #503, which was huge. It had so much space and felt like a honeymoon suite. It was our first time in Istanbul and the staff were very helpful in recommending places to go. They made restaurant reservations for us and we walked to some excellent restaurants and ate delicious food outside watching the world go by. The hotel was in an ideal location for sightseeing-we did not need any taxis but used trams and walked everywhere. Something needed fixing in our room,and this was dealt with straight away. The staff were so friendly and helpful. We loved our romantic stay at this superb hotel,and would certainly recommend it as the perfect hotel for your first visit to Istanbul. Alicia and Owen

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Maxineintassie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this delightful place twice this month. The first time was for one night, tired and jet-lagged after the long haul from Australia and having broken my reading glasses on the plane!. Not only did Mustafa on the desk (sorry if I have mixed up the names!) upgrade me to a suite at no extra cost but, given that during the day he is an optician, he effected a repair on my glasses! Returning for a 5 night stay with my daughter later in the month we had a twin room (205) which was roomy, clean and quiet with one of the quietest air conditioners I have ever encountered in a hotel room. I even ended up opening the window at night so as to not miss the morning call to prayer which I loved hearing. Sitting on the roof top terrace was lovely (apart from being thrashed at scrabble by the afore-mentioned daughter) and the breakfast room facing on to the courtyard was gorgeous - better than many a 5 star property I've stayed in. Breakfast was included and was bountiful and delicious. During my second stay I was becoming unwell with the flu and the staff sent up pots of hot water so I could make herbal tea - also at no cost. I think anyone who has complaints about the sari konak has ridiculously high expectations. I was unable to fault it and in particular would like to praise the efficiency, kindness and good humour of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: StanW
Reviews.Content: Lived up to all the reviews: great location, marvelously friendly and helpful staff, and splendid breakfast buffet. I particularly enjoyed Sedar Cengiz, the night receptionist. Given the 10 hr. time difference between LA and Istanbul, he usually responded to my emails. He was very helpful setting up my reservations -- his replies were prompt, complete, and clearly written. When I got there, I went down to meet him. He was just as delightful in person. I often have trouble sleeping so I went down several times to read in the lounge and ended up chatting with him. He answered all my questions about things to do and see, and made a number of helpful suggestions. In addition he was fun to talk to about the country and the people. My only complaint was that in our standard room (which we had to shift to half way through our stay due to our late booking), the toilet seat was not securely fastened, so one tended to slide around a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto to all the other reviewers - a great place!”
Reviews.Author: washingtondcfan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sari Konak for four nights. I can only reiterate what everyone else is saying--what a wonderful place! The rooms are nice (not overly luxurious--but really nice); my wireless internet worked perfectly; the hotel staff was unfailingly helpful and friendly; the terrace on the roof is lovely (although they just finished working on it, so had a lot of construction material on it); the location is perfect; and the breakfast was terrific. The staff was always willing to answer our questions or give us advice. When booking our stay, they answered our emails promptly and always answered our questions. (Serdar Cengiz, with whom I primarily corresponded, and who helped us out a lot while we were there, was just terrific). They truly deserve their fine reputation. I just feel lucky that we were able to book a room there. Thanks Trip Advisor! Probably wouldn't have found them without ou.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJCB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Sari Konak Hotel. This place is a little gem! It is perfectly located for all of the major sights of Old Istanbul. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. It was lovely in the evening to be able to relax on the roof top terrace with views over the Bosporos after a busy days sightseeing. I would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place I've Stayed In Europe”
Reviews.Author: HerbieTheHusker
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sari Konak was fabulous! From check in to departure, we couldn't have asked for anything better. The staff were friendly and always willing to give advice...and their advice was perfect! They offered recommendations for what to see, where to go, who to talk to about buying a Turkish rug, where to eat and even arranged tours for us. The hotel was beautiful and very well maintained. Our room was spacious, the bathroom modern and cheery and there was FREE WI FI! The breakfast each morning was a treat to start the day. And all of this for an absolutely exceptional value. The service cannot be beat anywhere! I've traveled the world and this was by far the best experience I've had. If we make it back to Istanbul, we wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else and we highly recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: alex1212
Reviews.Content: We're a young couple who stayed at the Sari Konak for about five days. We will definitely go back the next time we visit Istanbul. The hotel is located in an elegant old building on a quiet street in Sultanahmet, the central neighborhood for tourists. Rooms are very clean and pleasant, and prices include a generous breakfast. There is also a roof deck for evening drinks that has beautiful views of the Bosphorus. But what sets the hotel apart are the staff, who fuss over the guests as if they were family, and who are unfailingly helpful at all hours--particularly the incredibly generous Mustafa. On returning for our second stay during a three-week trip, we were greeted like old friends. There is free wifi access, as well as a computer that guests without their own laptops can use. Request a room on a higher floor if you want more privacy, as the first-floor rooms face the street and can feel somewhat exposed when the windows are open.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: levster
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough good things about this gem of a hotel. The room was clean, nicely furnished and very quiet, which we appreciated after 14 hours of air travel and jet lag. We had a deluxe room facing the street which is very quiet. We did hear the call-to-prayer at 5 am (sunrise) but only because we happened to be awake from jet lag, The second morning we slept thru it. We can't say enough about how nice and helpful all of the hotel staff were. They helped us plan our daily itinerary, recommended nearby restaurants, and answered every request. Breakfast in thecourtyard next to the ancient wall was delightful. Free internet was a real plus. Room rates were reasonable compared to other hotels nearby. The hotel is located in a virtually perfect location, only a five minute walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and Topkapi Palace. It's also close to the nearby tram which we took to the Grand Bazaar and Dolmabace Palace. A real treat, not to be missed, is to have a drink on the rooftop terrace in the evening, where you have a great view of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. We would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hubert18
Reviews.Content: We, a German couple in the sixties stayed there in early August for 5 days. It was too hot but the air condition of the hotel was functioning very well. The hotel is perfectly situated between the most interesting places to visit in Istanbul, it is easy to reach and surprisingly quiet. We were impressed by the very good website and also by the descriptions in travel guide books. Booking via internet run smoothly. We booked the airport pick up service and this went also very well although we were delayed more than one hour. The room was very nice and comfortable. In the evening, the roof terrace is a very pleasant place with a magnificent view to the blue mosque. Most friendly, competent and helpful were the people at the reception desk who ordered dependable taxi drivers and gave good suggestions for restaurants. The staff for the very good breakfast in an impressive patio was also friendly. When we will be again in Istanbul we will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality at the Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sari Konak with two friends of mine for four nights in August of 2008. We spent three nights in Room 502, which is the two bedroom apartment. It was really spacious and lovely. The rooms had AC which was great because it was really hot while we were there. My only small complaint would be that there was a bit of mildew in the bathroom shower, but I've seen worse. Mustafa at the front desk was funny and charming and helpful. Really, all the staff were really nice and friendly. The hotel has a GREAT rooftop deck with views of the blue mosque. One night, we bought beer up there and hung out, but on another night, the front desk said that they might not be able to serve us beer on the rooftop, and they suggested we go to the little store aroudn the corner and buy some, which we did. We spent a great rest of the evening on the rooftop, listening to the call to prayer and just generally relaxing. Breakfast is really nice and there's a small courtyard with four tables of four. Our last night, we moved to 503, which was the other apartment. It's a bit honeymoon suite-esque as the bedroom is really large. There's a living area attached to a kitche, which is a nice feature. They put a cot in the living room for me which was fine. All in all, I thought this was a lovely little place and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: PierCove
Reviews.Content: We were at the Sari Konak for three days, the first two in a standard room and the last in a deluxe room (hotel alerted us when we checked in that they wished to move us, no extra cost). Staff was helpful, inviting us to drink coffee and/or have breakfast while we waited for our room to be ready (it was ready by 11:30 a.m.) They gave us a great map, helped us plan some sightseeing and were very reassuring that they would get us a taxi at 3:00 a.m. for an early flight (they did so). Standard room was a bit small, but very clean and the air conditioning worked well. Deluxe room (303) was slightly larger and more elegantly furnished. If your budget can absorb the difference in cost, we'd recommend the better room. Location is very convenient in the heart of Sultanahmet, and street noise is a bit less than other hotels because it is a half block down the hill from the most crowded street. Breakfast was lovely, in a ground floor patio. There is a rooftop terrace, but it was being renovated and its skylight made it very hot in daytime--a better option is to have a drink or dinner at one of the many hotel terraces nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: speedracerbg
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at Hotel Sari Konak. The front desk staff were all excellent, answering our numerous questions, and providing advice on our daily activities around Istanbul. We had no luggage for the first day, and Oktay helped us to contact the airport and trace our luggage. It was nice to return to the hotel at the end of a busy day and be welcomed back by Mustafa. Hakan was also very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet included hard-boiled eggs, bread, range of jams, cereals, fruit, etc. and was quite tasty. Service was very good. We spent two nights at the hotel, then went to Cappadoccia, then returned to the hotel for 3 more nights. The second room we stayed in was larger than the first, however, the bathroom in the first room was larger and seemed more recently renovated. The location of the hotel was excellent; just a minute's walk from the Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque and the Hagya Sofya. Many nice restaurants across the street from the hotel and within very close walking distance. Easy access (7 minute walk) to the Sultanahmet tram stop. We would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Sari Konak again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: Booklover1947
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and staff. Rooms were spacious and clean. Front desk staff helped to book tours and were very good at recommending restaurants, etc. Breakfast was included in a lovely courtyard which gave an excellent beginning to each day. Definitely would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: Crads4
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sari Konak. The management and staff made us feel so welcome that it was really a "home from home" . Nothing was too much trouble for them. We are a family of 4 and we stayed in a beautiful suite which was very spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. The Hotel is very well situated - only a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hoghia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. It is also within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: doodleizer
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul with my mom for a week. The Sari Konak Hotel made my stay in Istanbul absolutely wonderful. The hotel could not have been better. Everything about it was great. We were welcomed into the hotel very graciously by the wonderful staff. The two brothers who run the hotel are so kind and helpful. And the people at the front desk are always eager to give any advice or support. If you are taking a taxi somewhere from the hotel, ask the people at the hotel how much your ride should cost. We got scammed pretty badly because we didn't know how much the taxi fare would be at one point. Always check that the meter is on before you go anywhere. I got very sick while I was at the Sari Konak, and one of the owners sent me to his English speaking doctor. I was prescribed medicine and everything turned out to be okay. But I don't know what I would have done if the nice people at the hotel hadn't helped me. Not only are the people at the Sari Konak great, but so is the hotel itself. The location is perfect. It is just a couple minutes away from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace. The view from the hotel roof is incredible. You have a clear, beautiful view of the Blue Mosque. My blue mosque pictures from that roof are some of the best from my trip. The rooms are nice, too. The air conditioning saved my life in the summer heat. But know that the sink water is not potable so you have to brush your teeth with bottled water. Our favorite part of our stay were the memorable breakfasts. We ate outside every morning next to an ancient wall covered in vines. The breakfast was fantastic. Three kinds of bread, eggs, tomato, cucumber, dried fruit, granola, yogurt, cereal, thin slices of meat, fruit, and probably much more that I can't think of. And while they say that breakfast ends at 10:00, a few days we finished at 11:00 and no one seemed to mind. We love the Sari Konak! I guarantee that you will have a fantastic stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: vacationer008
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, clean hotel in a convenient area, this is the hotel for you. Not only are the rooms well-appointed, but the staff is extremely knowledgable as well. When my husband experienced a medical problem, the manager quickly referred him to a fine medical center and was able to get him an appointment for that morning. He also made sure the cab driver knew where we were going. All of the staff are friendly and caring. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and recommend the hotel to travelers to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “All that we expected”
Reviews.Author: jgsSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after seeing it so highly recommended in Tripadvisor reviews - so thanks to all the reviewers. I can only agree with what I read before I went - fabulous location, super helpful staff, charming authentic decor, comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast. The hotel website is excellent, with many (accurate) photos, and the staff were very helpful in answering queries before we set out. We took Suite 501, in the basement of the adjoining building, as my husband and I were travelling with our 21 year old, and although there was enough space, there was not a lot of privacy, as the two separate sleeping areas have no doors. If booking again I would pay a little more for the suite above, with two proper bedrooms. Having said that, the suite we had was very good value for money. We also saved by paying our account in cash - they offer a 10% discount! The hotel has no restaurant , but is surrounded by them, and we were very well advised of which were worth a visit by the front desk staff - thanks Mustafa! We were also grateful for general advice about carpet salesmen and the like! It does have a wonderful rooftop terrace bar though, where we swooned on the first night we arrived as we watched the sun set behind the nearby Blue Mosque! We were within easy walking distance of many of the unmissable sights of the old city, and found it easy to see the other things we wanted by public transport, which is nearby too. We loved Istanbul, and we loved this little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok”
Reviews.Author: donnakaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights in June. I had requested a suite for the four nights and was told that one was available for only the last two nights and a deluxe for the first two. After reading the good reveiws I acepted this. Upon check in I was told that we wouldn't have to change rooms at all, great I thought. No, they gave our suite away and wanted us to stay in the deluxe room. One of reasons I chose this place was because I could see on their website that the suites were a good size. After seeing how tiny the deluxe was, I went down and told them that I was not happy. They should have contacted me with this change and I would have made other arangements. In the end they agreed to give us the suite. It was like three times the size and well worth the extra money. This little mishap aside though, I found this hotel very average. The roof top serves drinks and my husbands gin and tonic was $10US, just so you know. Of course this didn't stop him from ordering a few. I just didn't get that warm feeling that others felt. Across the street at "Angles House" is where I would stay next.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamBoycee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sari Konak for 5 nights. Great location - quiet area but close to sights, restaurants etc. Very friendly and helpful staff. We loved the roof terrace for its views, and a beautiful place to sit in the evening. Call to prayer in the early hours is shockingly loud the first time you hear it but we got used to it. Rooms OK - clean and well maintained. Breakfast good. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Option in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: needtotravel00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sari Konak for four nights in May and were very glad to have chosen it for our stay in Istanbul. The rooms were charming, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and breakfast was excellent! We enjoyed the rooftop terrace at sunset each night - the view of the Blue Mosque can't be beat. The hotel is in a great spot, in a quieter neighborhood that is easily walkable to most of the key sites, with a number of good restaurants around the corner. We'd stay there again and would send our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolblue
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Sari Konak, and enjoyed it immensely. The property is spotlessly clean (and I'm a clean freak). The bathroom in our deluxe room was exceptional (although the tub had high sides to climb over to enter). The deluxe room was spacious. Our room (#103) was on the front of the hotel on a lower floor. We heard street noises at night, but not a big deal. And I loved hearing the call to prayer from the nearby Blue Mosque ... loud, yes, but certainly like nothing I hear at my South Carolina home. I found it hauntingly beautiful. The roof garden is a wonderful surprise. One direction faces the Bosphorus with its shipping traffic, and when you turn the other direction the incredible Blue Mosque is RIGHT THERE. Get up early one morning and take a photo of the mosque when the sun is shining on its golden-tipped minarets ... incredible. There are indoor and outdoor sitting areas in the roof garden, and we were surprised that we were always the only guests up there. Breakfast buffet is ready at 8:00AM on the dot and is a delicious European-style. Filling and nutritious. The staff was excellent and answered all our questions. Mustafa particularly was helpful in offering a recommendation for the nearby Magnaura Cafe (which is WONDERFUL....we ate there twice). And Nihat (Nico) arranged a Bosphorous Cruise for use where all we had to do was step out the front door and be picked up by the tour bus. All in all, I was reluctant to try a smaller independent hotel in Istanbul, but my huisband and I can highly recommend the Sari Konak. We hope to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: traveller1968
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the glowing reviews of this great hotel. It really lived up to expectations. It is small and friendly and the staff were all great. They were always so helpful and we really felt taken care of. The hotel is very clean, in good condition and tastefully decorated with lots of Turkish touches such as the Ottoman sofas in the breakfast area and the carved wooden doors on the lifts. We had a standard room which was pretty small but for the price and location we felt it was good value. Beware that proximity to the Blue Mosque also means being woken up at 5.00 am by the call to prayer which was really loud. We almost jumped out of bed with shock the first night but a few days later hardly noticed it any more and it does really come with the territory. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: egu
Reviews.Content: The hotel Sari Konak has an excellent location just next to the Blue Mosque.
