It has everything a good hotel should have: Nice rooms (we chose a "de luxe room", which is more spacious, and worth the extra money, I think), spotless bathrooms without a single crack in the tiles, nice breakfast (unfortunately we were too early to enjoy it outside in the charming back yard, but nice anyway) - and, as I said, a very good location. Add to that a roof terrace with direct view to the Blue Mosque one way and a panoramic view of the Marmara Sea the other way. But what makes the Sari Konak special, is the staff. We felt welcome from the minute we walked in the door (well, from the first e-mail correspondence, really), and it lasted until they waved us goodbye when we left for the airport. I don't think the word "problem" exists in their vocabulary. So, in short, if you're going to Istanbul and are able to get a room at the Sari Konak: Don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “Mr Okan is an excellent host!”
Reviews.Author: sarikonakrules
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this excellent hotel for five nights in March and enjoyed every minute of it. The rooms are cozy and comfortable, the staff are friendly and helpful, the neighborhood is quiet and filled with great restaurants. The best part of the stay was the included breakfast, and the company of the very friendly and helpful owner, MR. OKAN. He never gets his name mentioned on the internet, but he deserves it. He is so genuinely interested in making your stay excellent that he would sooner tie a stone around his neck and throw himself into the Bosphorus rather than allow you to have a bad stay at his hotel. Make sure you get to his breakfast early so you can joke and laugh with him. The other staff are also nice. We were too early in the season to enjoy the rooftop bar and garden, but it is sure to be lovely in the summer since the view of the mosques and museums and sea are so excellent. We returned to Istanbul for two days at the end of our vacation and stayed in the Blue House hotel and were disappointed that it was not so friendly or comfortable or charming as Sari Konak. It was also more expensive than Sari Konak! It is clear upon entering the Sari Konak that it is family owned and operated and they take great pride in their business. This seems to be reflected in everything they do, I have never seen a hotel website that shows photos of all of the staff, including the cleaners! Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: goneforthesummer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 6 nights at the Sari Konak and absolutely loved it. The location is fantastic - it's had to beat a 3 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The rooms are fine - a little small, but for the location and the price, completely fine. What really stood out was the staff - tremendously friendly and helpful. I'd definitely recommend the hotel (as well as staying Sultanamet, in general) to anyone planning on visiting Istanbul. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Herbs_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sari Konak hotel in Istanbul last summer with our 2 small children. We were attracted to the hotel because of itâ€™s close proximity to all the sights. All the main sights were just a short walk away â€“ and the tramline was also very close. The welcome we received at the Hotel was very warm and friendly and the check in process was efficient. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and spacious and the dÃ©cor and furnishings were of a high standard. The service is the Hotel was second to none - The staff were very approachable and keen to please. They were informative and happy to give advice. In particular, Elif was a big hit with the children â€“ she made time to chat with them every day and they looked forward to seeing her. She even arranged a birthday cake for our daughterâ€™s 4th birthday and set up a table in the dining area for us to sit down and enjoy it. Our daughter was over the moon. The courtyard with the breakfast area was very picturesque and the breakfast buffet was varied and filling. The roof terrace was peaceful and relaxing and the view was sensational. All in all â€“ we had a fabulous holiday and an extremely pleasant and relaxing stay at the Sari Konak. We recommend the Hotel to anyone â€“ families, couples or friends, and we look forward to going back there some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with service”
Reviews.Author: amyAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: great location but I agree with previous review that this hotel seems to be overrated. We stayed in three hotels in Istanbul and this was my least favorite. Location was good, rooms just okay though clean. The service was really unfriendly and impersonal, especially compared to other hotels in our three weeks in turkey. They didnâ€™t wake us up on the morning we left and acted like they did not remember we were to have breakfast that morning (they did give it to us). It also seemed to cater more to Americans than the others.. the computer had an American keyboard. On the other hand, the roof top patio was good (though not as good as Valide Sultan). Did not serve breakfast in it which seemed odd but also there isnâ€™t a restaurant so you can sit up on it all you want. We sat up there on our last afternoon, played checkers and looked out over the Sea of Marmara.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: NN&PN
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a week in Istanbul, where we stayed at the Sari Konak. Istanbul is a great city to visit and we encourage everyone to go. The reviews of the Sari Konak hotel are however very exaggerated. We travel quite a lot and probably stay at some 20 hotels/year. Our summary: + Great location + Great views from rooftop terrace +/- Price. Yes it's a decent price +/- Free wireless, but needed to sit in corridor to pick up signal - Very small rooms. We were upgraded to a deluxe room, and it was still small. Hard to find space to open luggage. (My pc screen was bigger than the TV, by the way.) - Not very clean. Bedlinen in our room were most probably not changed before our arrival, and certainly not changed every day. - Breakfast is traditional Turkish, which in this case means the entire offering fits into a 1x1 meter table. Among the worst breakfasts/smallest selections of all hotels we have stayed at. - Noisy. You hear other hotel guests taking showers and walking about. = Adjust your expectations. Convenient and decent, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Norway62
Reviews.Content: Greate Hotel with great location to every attractions in Istanbul. You can walk around to every attraction you want to see. The Hotel is placed in the backpacker street/area in sulthanamet. Hotel Sari Konak is a good ,warm and clean comfort hotel with good atmosphear with good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Istanbul - Overall a Good Stay at the Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: MDJDenver
Reviews.Content: We returned on 3/1 from an amazing week in Istanbul. We originally booked the Four Seasons Sultanhamet at $490 Euro per night. After much discussion, we decided we wanted a more authentic experience and chose the Sari Konak in Sultanhamet as our base. We booked suite 503 which is the largest room at the hotel. The rate was $159 Euro per night including taxes and breakfast (we had breakfast one morning and it was fine...yogurt, cheese, olives, bologna/mortadella, dried fruits, cereal and breads). The hotel provided complimentary transfer to the hotel from the airport which was perfect after the overnight flight. The driver was waiting and helped with luggage. Check in was easy and we had assistance to our room up a small staircase in the hotel's newer building. The suite was good sized, bright and generally in good shape. The rooms were decorated in a pleasing cream and beige palette as shown on the web site. The entry was wide and had a desk and two chairs which came in handy to store our purchases and coats. The couch in the small living room is adequate to rest tired feet but was not all that comfy to "lounge"....the cushions are ready for replacement. Three windows made the room bright and cheery and one window opened to allow in fresh air. There was no coffee table to rest drinks or snacks (all those wonderful desserts and turkish pistachios) but we pulled the small kitchen table into the living area and it served us well. There was a small, 20 inch flat screen TV with a few english channels including CNN and BBC which kept us up to date with current news events. The bathroom was small without a tub which was no problem as we prefer showers. The shower stall was equipped with a hand held shower however the shower head bracket did not work properly and did not hold the shower head while the water was on. We have been to many European hotels with this same set-up so while a minor inconvenience, there was no need to complain. Hot water was ok as long as we did not linger in the shower too long as it went from hot to cold back to hot. The shower had a small window that opened for fresh air. Two small, thin bath towels and two hand towels were provided each day and there was a heated towel rack which also served to heat the bathroom. There was mold around the shower base and shower window....while we were a bit put off by that, we didn't feel it warranted complaining...the climate is humid so I suppose mold can be a problem. The bedroom had a padded window seat and while large and decorated with nice fabrics and drapes, did not have adequate storage for a week....there was an armoire with hangers and a large safe (two laptops fit in it) but no other place to store clothes that did not require hanging. The bed was comfortable with a poly filled mattress cover that added a bit more softness. There was a medium sized vanity in the bedroom to store makeup allowing me to get ready while my husband was in the bathroom shaving. Two nightstands on each side of the bed for water and lights for night reading. Two large windows added to the brightness of the room during the day with darkening drapes for evening. The area was very quiet at night and we slept well (until the AM construction started). The small kitchenette was equipped with a tea kettle and an espresso machine as well as dishes, flatware and glasses. There was a mini fridge with a few juices and a bottle of water. We used the espresso machine the first few days until the hotel ran out of coffee pods for the unit which they never did refill even after going to the breakfast room and asking (no in room coffee for last three days). Slightly annoyed with this as we had to dress and go downstairs for that first cup of coffee. Free wireless internet with very fast speed. Elif (the manager) was there when we arrived and is as nice as others have stated. She arranged to have a birthday cake in the fridge for my husband as well as fresh flowers in the room (at a charge which I expected). She had the rest of our visit off and it appeared that the staff was stretched thin covering the shifts. Mustafe was great...but he worked day and night so was clearly tired. We didn't require much help other than to turn on the heat in our room or open the locked front door at night so it was not an issue. There was construction going on in the building behind the hotel (appears to be another hotel being installed) and across the street (another hotel being renovated) so there was quite a bit of noise in the mornings. While that would normally bother us, it served as our second wake up call after the first call to prayer (which we really miss - the call to prayer not the construction). There is a small market with items such as cola, water, wine (very expensive and not good) and snacks at the top of the street which was very convenient as the roof top terrace was closed for the season. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and a few more minutes to the tram stop which we found very easy to use (also very inexpensive). There is a street one block from the hotel lined with dining and we would highly recommend Albura.....wonderful food, good service and well priced. We tried the Antique Turquiose on the same street and it was horrible, really horrible....I can't recall a meal that bad in years. Service was equally poor so please save your lira (.... don't believe the gentleman who states u won't pay if u don't like it!!) and walk a few more steps to Albura. You will love the food and service at Albura. We did visit the Four Seasons which was a short walk from the Sari Konak. It is amazingly beautiful and amazingly over priced. We had two cocktails one evening before dinner and it was $90 Lira (two martinis and one cola) which was more than our entire meal with wine at Albura....try the Manti with yogurt/chili sauce. Istanbul is a wonderful place to visit with warm people who are willing to help! I'll never forgot our first few hours on the grounds outside the Blue Mosque, dazed with jet lag but knowing we had to keep going when a young policeman stopped to say hello...upon realizing we were American he asked if he could sit and talk with us (he wanted to practice his english and taught us a few phrases in Turkish)....we spent an hour chatting about cultures and politics....he left us with an offer of help while we were there and told us what days we could find him working and where. What an amazing welcome to a great city. We attended Eveline's Cooking AlaTurka class and had a wonderful meal with equally great conversation followed by a relaxing walk to see her new kitchen and dining spot. She provided her fav spots at the Spice Market and shared the vacuum pack tip which allowed us to bring back many wonderful spices - red pepper, pistachios, salted nuts, lemon salt and more. The new location is a 2 minute walk from the Sari Konak. If you are a foodie, take the class (information posted in the forum). We miss the people we had the good fortune to meet and speak to, the sites, food and the hauntingly beautiful call to prayer. So with all of that (more than a hotel review), we would recommend the Sari Konak to those wanting to stay in Sultanhamet in a very convenient location. PS..a few non hotel pictures posted...slices of Istanbul life!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: HaxtedMill
Reviews.Content: The Sari Konak Hotel is a hotel for the discerning traveller who wants a small, intimate hotel with a genuine warm welcome from staff who are happy that you have chosen their Hotel. Nothing is too much trouble, whether you are looking for a restaurant for a special celebration or a quiet dinner for two. Enquiries about directions are met with courtesy and patience as if it is the first time the question has ever been asked. The Deluxe room was charming and it really felt as if you were in Istanbul with a seat in the window overlooking the quiet cobbled street where the hotel is situated . Just below the Blue Mosque it is ideally placed to explore the old Sultanahemet area of Istanbul. In particular Elif Efe the Office Manager at the hotel was outstanding in her professionial capacity, especially dealing with a situation with a nearby restaurant which was quite frankly appallng. Even though it was not in her remit, she contacted the restaurant, complained on our behalf without us knowing and secured an apology from the restaurant and an invitation to dine the next evening free of charge. This we declined. This is true customer care and reflects the whole attitude of the staff at the Sari Konak Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Plus”
Reviews.Author: Putujem
Reviews.Content: We were one week in Istanbul and the weather was great (that was my biggest concern) - sunny and relatively warm for that time of year. We stayed in Sari Konak hotel which was great - clean, great staff and nice interior, both in our room and the rest of the hotel. Every positive critic on Tripadvisor is true and I would recommend this hotel to everyone that likes nice, clean hotels. The location is great - it's in the heart of the old city Sultanahmet, but very close to tram station. We paid around 80 euro per night (it is the price for low season) in the deluxe room. I recommend the deluxe room because it's a little bit expensive but much bigger and more comfortable than the standard rooms (I saw while the housekeepers were cleaning them). All in all very nice hotel and - if we would travel to Istanbul again - we would stay in Sari Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: LGR12
Reviews.Content: What a gem! The Sari Konak has a great location near the Blue Mosque. I had a sweet room with good, clean modern bathroom(plenty of hot water). The breakfast is to die for. The roof garden has a panoramic view of the Bospherous and the surrounding city. I could see the Blue Mosque from my room and heard the call to prayer every day - and night! The staff were so gracious and helpful. It was a treat to eat breakfast every morning in the small courtyard. I can't say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Sari Konak for 7 nights with my son. Upon check-in, I was upgraded to a suite with two bedrooms, a sitting room and a spacious bathroom. It was very comfortable and very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful with logistics, e.g., finding taxis, pharmacies, museums. The breakfast was wonderful and served by friendly and warm staff. The best part is the location. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood, just down the street from the Blue Mosque and in easy walking distance to the Haghia Sophia, Tokapi Palace and the Basilica Cisterns. The Grand Bazaar is about a 5-10 minute walk away. It was also an easy to walk to the tramway -- an excellent alternative to taxis and a fast way to get across the Galata Bridge. After long days of sightseeing and walking around this wonderful city, the Sari Konack was a welcoming and comfortable place to come back to. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: katie1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for three nights in Sept 07. It was a standard room on the third floor and had a small balcony with a beautiful view of the Blue Mosque. The room was pretty small (only space for the bed and one chair) and plain, but everything was very nice. I peeked in to the deluxe rooms and they were much larger - if I were to return, I would probably pay the extra money for the deluxe room. The rooftop deck with its view of the Blue Mosque was great for relaxing after a day of sightseeing in Istanbul. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel has a nice breakfast area including the option to sit outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “A great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: PaulM_8
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel as far as value for money is concerned. My wife and I spent a week in Istanbul, and were booked into a standard, small, no-frills room. It was clean, which is obviously important, but I could have used a slightly more comfortable bed, as I had a couple of nights of tossing and turning. However, the hotel's perfect location, helpful staff, free internet and the delicious breakfast buffet more than made up for the lumpy bed (which, had I complained about it, probably would have been dealt with, perhaps by a change to another room). The Sari Konak also gives its guests a survey to fill out the night before checkout, so it's pretty clear they're trying to maintain a guest-first approach. I would definitely recommend the Sari Konak, although next time we'll spend a bit more and upgrade to a slightly larger and more comfortable room - definitely worth the extra lira.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: helsaltertravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Sari Konak in Istanbul in September , we were a group of five that wanted a good place as a base for exploring Istanbul and surroundings for 5 days. The hotel had a very good location in Sultanahmnet, with walking distance to several of the "must-see" sights such as the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and Topkapi, as well as the Grand Bazar. It is not so far away from the more modern Beyoglu either, one can walk there (30 minutes) or take a taxi (5-10 minutes).The rooms were medium sized and clean and nice. The roof terrace was very nice to have breakfast on (it is covered by a "glass house", so it works also when it is raining, which it did quite a lot during our stay...). But the best thing was the staff and the helpfulness that they showed. They were very friendly and helpful when explaining about how to find the different sights in the city and giving general advise, as well as recommending restaurants. The pick-up service to and from the airport also worked very well. A stay here is recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: newyorkertraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm very picky about cleanliness of hotels rooms (i am one of those people who do not walk barefoot in most carpeted rooms and sleep only under the flat sheet without touching the top blanket in the US). Sari Konak really impressed me of how well kept their rooms are. I was actually comfortable walking barefoot and slept very well on their beds. The staff is extremely helpful with suggestions, and accommodating with our lost luggage, etc, etc. And all this without the attitude that a tip is expected with every service which is refreshing and rare these days--and you actually would want to tip them because of this. Location is very central and convenient and I love the fact that it is a small, intimate hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, but I wouldn't call it a boutique”
Reviews.Author: KENYASAFARIGIRL
Reviews.Content: Ok, the hotel was cute and I stayed in what I think was the smallest/cheapest of the rooms, so I do not have a full perspective of the place. However, I disagree with the previous reviewers and found the staff to be cold and far from what I consider to be an example of the Turkish hospitality I found so warm elsewhere. I arrived and my luggage was carried up the small flight to the service elevator, but that was it. I had no assistance to my room, which I found off-putting, however it could have been a cultural difference. I asked about restaurants and was told just to "make a right and there are several" -- no further directions on which ones to choose, which right to make (immediate or a block up) etc. My room was freezing and I couldn't get the heat to work. My room I'd equate with a hostel, but at $90 a night, it was an exceptionally overpriced hostel. The room was small, but that I didn't mind at all. There are several in the area that are entirely equivalent, and I didn't find Sari Konak special, unique and certainly not the 3rd best hotel in Istanbul. My advice: Unless you're staying in the best of their rooms, don't choose Sari Konak. There are better places with more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Justin6
Reviews.Content: Must concur with all the positive reviews. A beautiful old building in a great location. Super friendly staff, and tasty turkish/ continental spread in their lovely breakfast room. My only tip is the least expensive rooms are smallish (though adequate for our needs). So if you want a bigger room, just book their next level up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel! A gem”
Reviews.Author: Staffstraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Istanbul. An amazing city with friendly people, great food and the most incredible skyline with all the mosques and palaces. The hotel was wonderful. Perfect location in the most picturesque part of town, right by the main historical sights and a short tram ride away from everything you'll want to see. We had a deluxe room looking out on the street which was worth the few extra euros, but the smaller rooms looked ok too. The staff were so friendly and helpful, Map give to us on arrival with all the main sights pointed out and tips on how to get around. Take Mustafa's dinner recommendations - three great evening meals within easy walking distance of the hotel. And the view of the Blue Mosque from the terrace is just breathtaking, and there are views out over the Bosporus too. We have a knack for finding great little hotels on our travels, and this is certainly one of the best we've ever stayed in. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay such an enjoyable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: mog70
Reviews.Content: We recently (Nov 2007) spent 3 nights at the Sari Konak hotel in Istanbul. It was booked thru a travel agent. Our overall experience was excellent. We stayed in the family suite #502. It was great since we have 2 small children. The only reservation we had was that it was quite expensive (But then most places in Istanbul/SultanAhmet are). We paid ~200 Euro/night for the family suite. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Since we arrived in the morning from an early flight, they were very accomodating at letting us checkin very early. Also, on our departure date, the staff woke up especially early to provide us with a nice breakfast before our flight. If you can afford it, I would definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: madqdog
Reviews.Content: On this, our second trip to Istanbul in as many months, we "discovered" Sari Konak, and the positive reviews previously expressed are right on target. Quiet, clean, spacious (for Istanbul) and an abundance of non-smoking rooms. Excellent, attentive, and caring staff with many fine recommendations for dining, shopping, and what to do and not do re: various tourist destinations. Having stayed at another "top ten" Tripadvisor locale in Istanbul as of this writing last month, and reacted to that hotel with dismay, we can definitely state that we have found our home in this most fascinating city, and that home is the Sari Konak.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: Jim-Oakley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, our daughter and son-in-law, our son and our four grandchildren spent a week in the SKH at the beginning fo November. It is very central: most days we would spend our mornings sight-seeing, and the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, and the Topkapi museum are all within 5 to 10 minutes walk. Most afternoons seemed to involve 'retail theraphy' so we would take the tramway from the Sultanahmed stop, about 5 minutes away, to the Grand Bazaar, where the grandchildren seemed to manage to visit most of the 4,500 shops alleged to be there. The rooms were recently decorated, comfortable and very clean. We took 2 of the suites, Nos 502 and 503 which were roomy and comfortable. But beware, they have no cooking facilities! Despite the fact that most of my family fancy themselves as cooks, this was not a great drawback; there are lots of good-value restaurants within two minutes walk of the hotel, and some evenings we got takeaways. The included breakfast was super. Lots of fruit and yoghurt for the health-food nutters (every family has it's little problems), and lots of salami, cheeses, tomatoes, eggs, various breads, etc for the cholesterol hunters. We really enjoyed our visit, and we generally agreed that the outstanding feature was the friendliness of all of the staff - in particular, Mustafa and Elif on the front desk, Ilhan serving breakfast, and Murat in the back office.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Travelbudfla
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms. Ours overlooked the street - We were worried about noise, but didn't hear a thing at night ( even during Ramadan) and slept extremely well. We had a regular, not a deluxe room - pretty basic furnishings, but it had a TV, refrigerator, AC, decent size bathroom with a blow dryer and didn't feel cramped. Staff is outstanding - particularly the young men who run the place - they were extremely friendly and very helpful. They will go out of their way to chat, give recommendations, etc. Breakfasts were good - big selection (cold meats, cheeses, cererals, cakes, veggies, fruits, yogurt, etc.) in a lovely little courtyard or adjoining room overlooking the courtyard. Hotel is within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. We did get lost a few times returning after dark - Sultanhamet is extremely confusing. Even some of the shopkeepers/cabbies weren't sure where the hotel was, and we ended up at nearby hotels with similar names. But, that's our own fault for not paying closer attention to neighboring landmarks. We finally got our bearings on the second to last day! One more thing - the rooftop terrace was wonderful!! We had drinks up there every night, and basked in the great views of the Blue Mosque. During the day, the terrace features fantastic views of the sea as well. All in all, a great base for touring the old city. We had a wonderful time, and felt very welcomed everywhere we went.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: DCMANYC
Reviews.Content: I echo the other comments here - nice place, great location (including terrace with fantastic view of the Blue Mosque and the water), hospitable clerk, etc. I would note, however, that the first tried to put us in room 106 (right up the 5 steps from the front desk) which was terribly loud and you could hear everything. We transferred to a room on the second floor, which was much quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: OldCanuck
Reviews.Content: This private hotel is located in an area that we describe as a village in Istanbul. It has its own atmosphere. The hotel is very nice, the staff is wonderfully helpful and we would definitely stay there again on another visit to Istanbul. The view from the roof top terrace shows the Blue Mosque in all its glory as well as the Bosphorus on the opposite side. A big WOW factor.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: UpperWestSide72
Reviews.Content: The Sari Konak Hotel is a real gem in Istanbul. It was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. Not because it was the most luxurious hotel, but rather because it was like staying with family who really care for you. The owners are a truly delightful for whom nothing is too much trouble. If you do not feel at home here then you will never feel at home anywhere. The hotel itself cannot be better located with most of the major attractions of Sultanahmet within easy walking distance (we are talking 5 minutes at most to the Hippodrome). The rooms are comfortable, clean and very attractive. The roof top bar and lounge had wonderful views of the Marmara Sea; our room was of a very good size and had comfortable beds. The bathroom, while snug, was very modern and clean. The air-conditioning worked well and we both enjoyed a great night's sleep. Those who complain about the Call to Prayer don't seem to have ever been to a Muslim country before. It is part of the experience; just enjoy it as you can't change it. Blaming the hotel for being close to a mosque is ridiculous. For our part we found the rooms very quiet and slept soundly all night. The breakfast is a treat. Breakfast itself includes yoghurt, fruits, cheeses, fresh breads, cereals and coffee, tea and juice. In particular, the feta cheese was always fresh and tasty. Those looking for greasy bacon and eggs are not going to be happy, but those looking for a fresh and healthy start to the day will be very happy. The Sari Konak may not have all the luxuries of a large chain, but it more than makes up for that with the warmth of the hospitality and the personal touch. If you are interested in purchasing a rug, then look no further than the Anatolia Art, Kilins and Carpets House next to the Sari Konak, the owner Bayramis very friendly and has the best prices , we purchased three rugs. Our favorite restaurants were Giritli, the Mozaik restaurant and its sister Rumeli next door they all were excellent and all had friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfuly charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGaels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sari Konak for the first leg of our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier. Everything about the place was wonderful and we couldn't have navigated Istabul as well as we did without the helpful staff. One of the highlights of our trip to Turkey to be sure.

Reviews.Title: “Sari Konak, a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoomerTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and couldn't have had a better location in the old town. The hotel was close to the Blue Mosque, Hagi Sophia, and a reasonable walk to the Grand Bazaar and the Topkaki Palace. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Good buffet breakfast and the hotel is close to several restaurants. Wireless access at no charge, but it bogged down at times. The room was small and the bathroom was OK. The call to prayers at 5:30AM from the Blue Mosque got us going in the morning. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming oasis”
Reviews.Author: Chirk
Reviews.Content: We had just one night in Istanbul after a cruise, and chose Sari Konak for its location, rooftop view of the Blue Mosque, and the positive reviews. It was in a quiet side street that was very difficult for the cabbie to find, but just around the corner from the Blue Mosque. The room was simple, European tight, but had an unexpected bonus: a tiny balcony that looked right at the Mosque! The staff was friendly. We were promised early breakfast as we had an early flight, but all we got was coffee, which was disappointing. Call to prayers came at about 5:30, and it was VERY loud, so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: devans27
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay in the Sari Konak Oct. 5 - 9, 2007. The location is excellent, and the hotel was very good. The roof garden is fantastic. If you have the money (about 200 euros a night), I'd recommend suite 503 in the new wing. It was like having our own very stylish and comfortable apartment in Istanbul. We had considered staying at the Four Seasons, but for half the money we got twice the space in just as good a location. It was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Delightful accomodation”
Reviews.Author: CeeJay55
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 4 nights. The hotel was charming and very friendly and the staff were wonderful. The views from the top floor Restaurant were fantastic. Our room was very small, however, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was delicious and located in a quaint courtyard. Location was easy walking distance from all the attactions and restaurants. We would stay at the Sari Konak again. We agree with all the positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cebazat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for 5 nights and could not have wished for a better hotel in a good location. We had a deluxe room (wih a mini fridge), which although not large, was adequate. The staff were friendly and professional, and treated us like good friends. The bunch of flowers in our room was an added bonus. Breakfast was served in a delightful courtyard and here we compared sights with fellow travellers. Watch the marble stairs though, as my husband tripped and fell. However he was taken good care of by a lovely couple from Canada (he landed at their door!) and by Mustaph on the reception desk. We had to leave Istanbul on a very early flight but were given coffee and food while waiting for the taxi - a service that does not happen in large hotels. We would certainly stay again and recommend it to other travellers. Sheila & Maurice, Canberra, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TT-Traveller
Reviews.Content: After researching on TA, we booked our reservation at the Sari Konak for the first leg of our Turkey vacation. The cab driver got slightly lost on the way to the hotel but we eventually made it. Upon entering, we were greeted personally by name, with smiles and jokes and handshakes and quickly directed to our rooms. We immediately felt at home. The staff was very helpful in giving directions and recommendations of places to eat and sites to visit. They also provided currency exchange service for a small fee. The desk was attended to around the clock, and everyone there spoke very good English. There was also a computer with Internet available for use free of charge. The rooms were small but clean and more than met our needs. From our window, we had a view of the Blue Mosque. If I had to complain, the WC was tucked away in a small space behind the bathroom door. I'm a big guy, you get the picture. Besides that, really no other issues. Breakfast was great, with seating indoors or on the small internal courtyard patio. Cereal, cold cuts, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, fruit. A great start to every morning. The hotel is literally 5 minutes on foot to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofya and the underground cistern. With lots of great little stores, art shops and restaurants along the way. On evenings, the rooftop terrace is the perfect place to relax and chat about the days events over drinks (in our case, several Efes largers) with an unobstructed view of the illuminated Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. They do serve drinks on the terrace, but it is not manned at all times so you need to inform the front desk if you need service. Conversely, you can just buy what you want from the small convenience store at the corner and go self-serve style. The Hayat Cafe restaurant a block up the street from the hotel is a great stop for lunch or dinner. They serve Turkish food and its pretty tasty and fairly cheap. We also spent one night at the nearby Ottoman hotel. Also very nice. Review to follow.

Reviews.Title: “what a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: koszeg
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel and found the staff extremely helpful and the hotel very nice. The room was spotless , the breakfast was great --traditional turkish. In the evenings we really enjoyed sitting on the roof terrace. You have a magnificient view to the Blue Mosque and from the other side you can see the sea. Mustafa at the reception was great giving us help what to see and how to get to the major attractions. You must try the Turkish Bath in Istanbul as well . You can book it through the reception. I can't wait to go back to Istanbul and stay at Sari Konak again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: egoldnrio
Reviews.Content: My new home away from home. I promised myself, and the friends at Sari Konak, that I would write this review the day I returned. I owed it to them, and to all the travellers headed to Istanbul but overwhelmed by the choices of hotels. I'm sorry that I waited and let life back at home delay me! I absolutely love this place! I have been to Istanbul twice now, and part of my love of this hotel is influenced by my absolute love of this city and this country. The recent ten days that I spent here were an absolute delight. I settled into my room and it just felt like home. The staff is wonderful, kind, helpful, full of ideas and gently available. The architecture and decor is carefully chosen, warm, attractive. The breakfasts are something to look forward to morning after morning out on the quiet patio, served by lovely staff. The rooftoop terrace has a magnificent view, quiet and breathtaking and all alone at 7 am with views of the Bosphorus and the ships and the Blue Mosque just one block away, or spectacular at sunset or late at night with a drink as the lights of the city and the mosque and minarets and bridges -- oooh, it's too wonderful for words and is a great place to spend your time, all alone, curled up with a book or journal, taking in the sights and sounds, or with your friends. The hotel is located on a lovely and quiet street, with access to plenty of great shops and good restaurants and all the tourist sites of the old town -- 2 blocks from ARasta Bazaar shops, 2 blocks from the Blue Mosque -- I could walk these streets in any direction for days and days. Just explore this wonderful city and it's history and architecture and fabulous people to your hearts content -- there's so much to learn and see and absorb - and then you can always look forward after a long day of exploration to returning to your home at Hotel Sari Konak. It's a most comfortable spot. I wish I were there right this minute, and I will definitely return, again and again. Merhaba! Emily

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: Elise_O
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Turkey this spring, and chose the Hotel Sari Konak based largely on reviews from Trip Advisor. We were looking for a mid-range, but comfortable hotel, clean, with a central location to the popular sites in Istanbul. The Sari Konak was perfect. Book a deluxe rather than regular room to have a lovely view of the street and more space (and not a big price difference). The garden courtyard for breakfast is delightful, and the rooftop deck with panoramic views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosporus is fantastic-enjoy a glass of wine from their bar while watching the sun set and listening to the evening call to prayer. Sublime. What really make the Sari Konak special, though, are the staff. Special thanks to Sergun who repeatedly gave us excellent restaurant recommendations, and facilitated our navigation through Istanbul, including elaborate markings on the complimentary hotel city maps to help us catch ferries to the Asian side of the city for more off the track exploration. He is a totally genuine, sincerely friendly and open person-it felt more like getting recommendations from a friend than from the hotel front-desk. Everyone at the Konak was helpful and made us feel welcome-you'll have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place all-round”
Reviews.Author: Jaja69
Reviews.Content: I reserved our room based on reviews from TA members and everything posted were spot-on. Our deluxe room 301 on the street side was clean (though I had the impression that it was smaller than the pictures of the other deluxe rooms posted on their website) , the breakfast was generous and the location was fantastic. Since we were only visiting for the WE we managed to see to all places as planned and everywhere we went was on foot. I think what makes Sari Konak stands out most is the welcoming and helpful staff. We had an issue with the mode of transport to get to dinner on the Anatolian side and Mustafa, our receptionist for the day, with the help of the friendly young barman and a few phone calls later to the ferry company came up with the solution of taking the boat directly from Eminonu to the area where we have to be. That evening we got a bosphorus boat cruise and a ride to dinner all-in-one. Please also ask them for restaurant recos, you won't be disappointed. The free WiFi was also an added bonus. BTW, if you choose to sleep with the windows closed (and aircondition on ofcourse) you can barely hear the 5 am call for prayer from the Blue mosque. It also helps if you had one too many raki the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: gypsygal77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for 6 nights and it was eveything we could have asked for - the reviews on tripadvisor were right on the money! We stayed in a deluxe room which was lovely - very quiet and good air conditioning ( we were there in the heat wave). We ate breakfast every morning in the courtyard which was such a relaxing and pleasant way to start the day. The location is great, you can walk to the Blue Mosque as well as to the Sultan's Palace (Topkapi). It is about a 10 minute walk to the Metro which will take you to the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market and to the ferry if you want to go up the Bosphorous. For those of you who may be contemplating a Turkish Bath, my husband went to the Cagaloglu Hamam ( 300 year old Tukish Bath) for his first ever Turkish Bath and thought it was great - I personally, have never seen his face look so clean - it was like new skin! We discovered a great restaurant not far from the hotel called the Metropolis - if you are interested in going you would turn left out of the hotel, then the first street you come to, turn right and you will walk for a bit , the retaurant will be on your right - it is on a corner with outside tables - we found the food, service and staff to be great! We loved Istanbul and certainly the hotel, the very friendly and helpful staff all contributed to what was a wonderful time! As an added comment, even though we were leaving very early in the morning for the airport, they had freshly made coffee for us to send us off with a smile! Now that's service!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss”
Reviews.Author: KellyM777
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from an amazing trip to Turkey. We spent four nights at Hotel Sari Konak and loved it. The staff were wonderful and so helpful. The hotel is stunning and the location is perfect - you can walk everywhere. Our favorite time of day was when we returned from sight-seeing and went to the roof top terrace for a drink or two and watched the sun set and listened to the call to prayer. If you're trying to determine where to stay - book here you won't be disappointed. The morning breakfast is also a great start to the day. The hotel is immaculate and if we ever go back we'd stay there again. I hope this helps in your trip planning.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, wonderful hotel--especially the staff!”
Reviews.Author: dream_genie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days last year, and the warmth and hospitality of the staff was one of the highlights of our stay in Istanbul. Both Elif and Mustafa were the most kind and helpful people we've ever had the pleasure to meet. Elif gave us a map and a detailed description of the major sights to see, and she patiently answered our many questions (mainly on how to get around Istanbul). On our last day, we were checking out and, having made a few too many large purchases at the Grand Bazaar, we were desperate, thinking we'd never be able to get it all home. Mustafa drove us in HIS car through the winding streets of Istanbul to the UPS store to try to help us ship the packages home! We were amazed and touched by how much he extended himself to help us out--truly a first in all our travels. The hotel itself is extremely clean, well-run, and convenient to all the major sights--it's not far from the Blue Mosque, which you can see lit up from the roof at night. We loved the fresh breakfasts every morning, which featured Elif's home-baked cakes--delicious! We can't recommend this place highly enough--everyone really went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful stay in Istanbul. Thanks, and warmest greetings to Elif and Mustafa! Sharon and Robert

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: GratefulDave
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were a reasonable size for price and location. Nicely decorated. Good bathroom including shower. Great view from roof terrace. Real good breakfast in garden. We had the deluxe rooms. Whichever room you want, make sure it has air conditioning in the summer. I highly recommend this hotel. David

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: tgb_jc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a two week trip to Turkey, 4 days in Istanbul and this lovely hotel. They provide helpful, warm, and friendly service in this clean, convenient small family run hotel. I would stay there again without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Ambience and Affordability”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_heritage
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this delightful and well-located little hotel. It was comfortable, tasteful and friendly. The staff are excellent. Each staff member operates as an individual with a genuine and personalised service ethic rather than the corporate clone you get in major hotel chains. The rooms are on the small side but very stylish and who cares about the size when you're hardly there? Istanbul has so much to offer and you can get to most of it on foot from the Sari Konak. When you return to the hotel after a day of taking in the atmosphere of Istanbul, there is a great roof-top terrace or a downstairs courtyard where you can relax .... And none of this will challenge your credit card. Melbourne, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: cpw52
Reviews.Content: Istanbul can be a bit daunting, particularly for a family of five. We stayed at the Sari Konak last November for a five day stay in Istanbul. It was like an oasis. The rooms were small, but comfortable. The atmosphere was calm and inviting. The staff was very considerate and helpful. We felt as if we had old friends in the city. The passage of time between our stay and this review has only reinforced my initial feelings. I would stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: joyce_ch
Reviews.Content: Add our voice to the number of people who love this hotel. We stayed in room 301, a Deluxe Room. Although initially concerned about noise from the street or from the terrace bar above, we shouldn't have worried. I'm sensitive to noise, and the room was quiet as a pin at night. We found the family who runs the hotel to be helpful and attentive to detail. The breakfast was delightful and plentiful, and the ladies who worked in the breakfast area were efficient and pleasant. Whether dining on the lovely patio or indoors, the atmosphere was friendly, a bit exotic, and refreshingly lovely. We used the rooftop terrace a great deal. What a relaxing place! Whether just watching the ships come and go through the Bosphorus or listening to the clunk of seagulls walking on the plastic terrace cover, we loved our time up there. We were never awakened during sleep by the call to prayer, and we loved hearing it at other times during the day. Hearing it in "stereo" on the terrace was amazing. If we ever return to Istanbul, we'll stay at the Sari Konak. My only criticism is that our carpet was a bit dirty looking. All other details were wonderful--from the free map to the lovely little soaps and shampoos in the bathroom. Great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sari Konak Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TwoTOTravellers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 8 days in Istanbul, all spent at the Sari Konak. Can't say enough good things about our stay, both with the Istanbul experience as well as the Sari Konak experience. For starters, Istanbul needs at least a week; just too much to see in a shorter time period. There are too many mosques, museums, restaurants and stores (carpet!) to see and experience in a shorter period of time. (Don't miss the cisterns.). The Sari Konak is not the Four Seasons, but neither is it pretending to be. It is a small, local, family-owned and family-run hotel. The staff are all caring and sympathetic to the confusion of its foreign guests and enormously knowledgable and helpful. Unlike other hotels in the area, there is no sense that the hotel's secondary purpose is to sell tours or rugs. Because there is no restaurant( except the breakfast patio for guests), the rooftop terrace is a lovely respite at the end of the day, calm and relaxed with a wonderful viiew of the harbour and the Blue Mosque. The rooms are a good size and comfortable. The AC works and with the exception of the Muzzein's call to prayer at 5:30 am,the rooms are quiet. We highly recommend the hotel. (PS: Go to the rug store next door. We checked them all out and he is far and away the most trustworthy and the best. Anatolian Kilims and Carpets.)

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great, Great - Location, Hotel, Value, and especially the Staff!”
Reviews.Author: themice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for 2 nights at the end of a cruise. The staff were most helpful in answering my questions prior to our trip, and just as helpful after we arrived. This small hotel is located in the heart of the Sultanahmet district, conveniently located just a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Cistern, Topkapi, the tram and not far from the Grand Bazaar. The value is outstanding. I had contacted about 8 properties in the area, and the Sari Konak had the best rate/value of all of them. Our room was on the first floor, facing the street, but had wonderful A/C, TV and minibar. The furniture was basic, but clean and neat, and the room was a good size with a large bathroom, and large bed (similar to queen or maybe king size). The room was quiet and comfortable. The garden patio and breakfast buffet are wonderful. We did go up to look at the view from the rooftop terrace, but we were so busy that we never got back up there when anyone was around. It is a magnifiicent view!! The hotel also has free internet access, although we didn't use it. We would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel , location and staff”
Reviews.Author: jason333
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beatifully located hotel in May and I would definately stay here again when we come back to Istanbul...Beatiful rooftop terrace , lovely garden and delicious breakfast...The staff is very nice and helped us about anything we needed during our stay.I recommend Sari Konak to everyone without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Sari Konak is the perfect little hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jolliette
Reviews.Content: The Sari Konak was the perfect little hotel. We stayed 5 nights in May. I loved everything about it. It is perfectly located in Sultanahmet, with a magnificent view of the Blue Mosque from the terrace. Mustafa and the staff are really helpful in helping you organize your day and giving advice on the sights, restaurants etc. The hotel is clean, the rooms are great. I was upgraded to a deluxe room for the price of a standard double.. not really sure why but I was happy! The breakfast is delicious and hearty... fresh melon, the standard Turkish breakfast of feta, eggs, tomatoes, cucumbers and olives... cereal, yogurt and dried fruits. The homemade jam is so good. There is a shared laptop available for use and the terrace is beautiful for sitting on and listening to the call to prayer or looking out over the Bosphorus. The tram stop is not far away and there are cute little cafes in the area to eat at... but they can be a little pricey since it is the tourist part of town. We ate at Magnaura Cafe and enjoyed it very much. The Arasta Market close by is good for shopping, less hassle than the Grand Bazaar, although not nearly as big. Le Bazaar d'Orient at the Arasta Market is a little carpet shop and Murat is so helpful and patient while you make your decision! I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul and looking to stay in the Sultanahmet area. The hotel we had in Paris was a lot more expensive and not nearly as nice, so I think this place is definitely a find. Spend your nights in Istanbul here.. it is the perfect place !!!

Reviews.Title: “Oriental Dreams Do Come True”
Reviews.Author: Squirrella1512
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the SarI Konak Hotel in April and we were absolutely enchanted! OK, Istanbul is a superb city with lots of breathtaking sights, wonderful restaurants and spectacular views, but SarI Konak most certainly turned our holiday into an oriental dream. The central position of the hotel in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul makes it easy to walk to all the â€œhot spotsâ€� as well as to the superb restaurants that are recommended by the hotel. The room we slept in was elegantly furnished and featured a spacious and exceptionally clean bathroom (with deliciously-smelling thyme soap!). Also the breakfast area and the rooftop terrace are tastefully decorated with oriental trinkets, wooden chairs and tables, big beige cushions you can sink in and just enjoy... sitting on the rooftop terrace, sipping on some Turkish coffee, you feel like the world is at your feet! The Blue Mosque towers to your right, the bright blue sea gleams to your left â€“ and if you catch the right moment at night, you can enjoy the lit camii and the muezzin`s call, which will make your holiday in Istanbul a very special experience. The varied breakfast buffet is exceptionally tasty and will satisfy your every need â€“ from Turkish meals like simit, goat cheese and home-made cake to cereals, fruits and bread. The staff is friendly and helpful at all times â€“ we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and are firmly planning on going back there soon.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Always abroad if I have the opportunity
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Istanbul and Sari Konak Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mysticglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed here in March with a group of friends as we had a 20 year reunion. Really the staff were so helpful and friendly and very accommodating, they could not do enough for me, we took cruises on the Bosphorous, a folkloric evening/Sufi dancing and walked around so much. Continental breakfast was delicious and healthy and the waiters could not do enough for us. I would definitely recommend coming and staying here. I will DEFINITELY be back. Come to Istanbul and stay at this marvelous family accommodation. Its right in the centre of the tourist area with fab views of the mosque. We also saw the eclipse in March which was amazing. The Turkish people were so generous always offering us free cups of tea or sweets, they absolutely went out of our way for us individually and collectively. Absolutely outstanding from one very satisfied customer

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: kurtatyellowstone
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel in an ideal location just a few short blocks from the Blue Mosque and Hagiaa Sophia. The service was excellent (thanks, Sergun). We were lucky to be upgraded to the deluxe rooms which were adequately roomy, clean and comfortable. There is a great view from the terrace, very lovely breakfast and staff that caters well to your needs. We explained we wanted to travel to other parts of Turkey and they arranged a local travel agent (Florida Tours, THS Travel Group, Merih Gunay was our agent) to meet us at the hotel, discuss with us our desires, attitudes, price range and time allotment. He set us up with just what we wanted at a very reasonable price and everything worked like clockwork, transfers, airfares, ground transport and excellent guides customized to our agenda. We transported back to Istanbul and spent the last night at the Hotel Dersaadet, an equally impressive and only slightly more expensive boutique hotel also with very helpful staff. Our Turkey experience couldn't have been better. PS the cab drivers at the airport are notorious for overcharging, either insist they use their meter (they will tell you it is not working) or negotiate the appropriate fare in advance. Should be no more than 30 NTL to Sultanhamet.

Reviews.Title: “The best small hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: B_Sener
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my wedding in Istanbul and as part of the arrangements we had over 70 guests arriving from the UK. I chose Sari Konak as one of the few I recommended to our guests and it was by far one of the best small boutique hotels I have stayed anywhere in Europe. Sari Konak is right in the heart of Sultanahmet so for a visitor staying for a short time its location is superb. The rooms and apartments (which I highly recommend for families of 2-5 people) were beautifully clean, amazingly decorated and very relaxing (especially important after a hard days sightseeing) During our stay the staff and the owners were fantastic! Since we had a few people staying at the hotel we had a lot of complex room swapping, different check in check out dates etc. And this was all handled perfectly. Please please, if you are thinking of booking a hotel do not hesitate for a momet with Sari Konak. I should know as I have seen and witnessed some of the other hotels and their hospitality in the area and none of them meet the standards here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - best of Turkey”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise this hotel was! My family had stayed in other establishments in Turkey in the past, and there is good reason this beautiful and charming hotel is rated so high on this site. This hotel is clean and run by a wonderful and helpful staff who were most kind and provided advice when we needed it. We had a triple so we were kind of cramped, and the room was very basic, but we were still very pleased with the accomodations. The terrace was a wonderful relaxing spot with great views. The little garden and breakfast room reminded me of the best of boutique hotels in Paris. The location in Sultanahment is fantastic. The breakfast was one of the best we have had in Europe. Everything about this hotel was just right. Istanbul has enough mystique and charm to rival any European city. Its a magical place, if you can get over the problems with some of the merchants, taxi drivers and locals constantly trying to cheat Western tourists (i.e. a taxi ride to the hotel costs one figure and the exact same taxi ride from the hotel to that location the next day costs one fifth what you paid - I could give twenty more examples, this activity is CONSTANT). It really helps when you stay at a place as lovely as Sari Konak, with a wonderful and kind staff looking after you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AAW67
Reviews.Content: Loved the Sari Konak! Great location, a real deal including delicious breakfast. Recommend earplugs for the nearby Blue Mosque call to prayer. The front desk was unfailining helpful and cheerful. We saw some of the other hotels listed while we were walking around, and were very glad we picked the Sari Konak! For dining, would recommend the nearby Albura, wonderful food!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Noshi
Reviews.Content: Great location, it is only a short distance to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya (and practically anything else - we walked everywhere, to Grand Bazaar, and even Suleymaniye Camii.. it's not that far if you're into exploring) The morning prayer call didn't bother us at all, maybe because we were too tired and had a great sleep. Great breakfast - we loved the oranges and lime juice. Waiter was very friendly too. We usually talked to the reception staff, Mustaffa for tips on where to go and how to get there - he's the best and reallyreally friendly. Thanks to him, we saved a lot of money on transport. We stayed in Room 303... and it was great, although not as big as what I expected (as seen in hotel website) It was meticulously cleaned every morning. Great rooftop views too.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian&Alan
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend stay at the Sari Konak. As previous reviews have commented, the hotel is on a quiet street with a great view of the Blue Mosque. We stayed in Room 305, a suite, for 159 EUR per night incl. breakfast. The room was spacious and comfortable. Above all, the room was wonderfully quiet, without the only exception being the call for prayer each morning at 0500. The room was air conditioned, and had lots of window light all of which you can open. The bathroom was nice, with a jacuzzi bath and a shower head. There were very basic toiletries. Overall the staff were very friendly, all spoke good English, and were always happy to assist. We made reservations for dinner, a local guide and a hamman all of which were excellent. Transfers were also arranged to and from the airport which were smooth. Breakfast was a choice of cold meat, cheese, bread, jam and cereal. It was good. In summary, a nice hotel, with a great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: paisfeliz
Reviews.Content: This was a friendly, quaint hotel within spitting distance of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofya. The location is touristy, but you can walk to the two main historical sites and tons of restaurants. The view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus from the top of the hotel is fantastic! We had many a cocktail watching the sun set and the lights come on the Blue Mosque. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. The rooms were basic, but comfortable enough. Beware that the call to prayer happens at 5 a.m. and is very loud since the hotel is right near the Blue Mosque. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for a city break”
Reviews.Author: JuneDubai
Reviews.Content: Excellent base for a city break the hotel was situated only a couple of minutes walk from all the main tourist attractions. Although small the rooms were comfortable and very clean. The breakfast was wonderful. All the staff are exceptionally friendly helpful and well informed. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!”
Reviews.Author: alottatrips
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is very near to the top attractions in Istanbul. Just 2 blocks to blue mosque! The breakfast is delicious, and they serve typical food like cheese, tomato, olives, sesame seeds coveread bread and dry fruits like damascus with delicious turkish yorgurt. The staff is very friendly and they helped us in many occasions, such as: - Where we could have a hamami (turkish bath). They gave us lot of options, instead of pushing the one theyÂ´d receive commision; - How to get by tram to DolmabahÃ§e palace, and this really proved better than taxi; - They told us about the state run bosphorus trip, which costed us only 7 ytl (4 euro), instead of pushing us 30 euro trips sold by travel agencies. This saved us a lot of money. - And finally, the called us a taxi to go to the airport. I just have to show my gratituted and recommend them as they made our stay in Istanbul an even better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Maureen-Moscow
Reviews.Content: I just arrived back from a long weekend in Istanbul. My friends and I stayed at the Sari Konak for three nights. After finding this hotel online we emailed our room request and within a day it was confirmed. Upon arrival, the staff was amazing. They were helpful with directions, taxis, phone numbers and finding an excellent Turkish bath. The rooms were small but clean and cozy. Not a problem when you spend most of your day touring and shopping! Our beds were very comfortable. There was minimal noise in the hallways and we were able to sleep quite well. The only bad part was the 6am wake up call from a local Mosque! The breakfast was simple and delicious. Just the right amount to get your day started. Sari Konak is located just a few minutes walk away from many restaurants and one block from the Arasta Bazaar. A great alternative to the Grand Bazaar. The Blue Mosque and all the other sights were very close and it was easy to navigate to where we wanted to go. Upon returning to the hotel, we were always met with smiling faces and the staff was gracious and courteous. I highly suggest this hotel if you want a freindly face to return to after a day of touring this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: LondonMacleod
Reviews.Content: This is in the old district by the Blue Mosque. The rooms are very comfortable and breakfast is great. The staff are very friendly and are always happy to recommend somewhere for dinner. The roof terrace is brilliant, and the views of Istanbul are fantastic. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “clean, safe, close to major sights”
Reviews.Author: pbnyc
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Istanbul and stayed at Sari Konak for three nights. The hotel is very clean, safe, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Its on a side street away from the touts and crowds but yet a few steps from the blue mosque with easy access to all sights and to the tram. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “loved the homemade cake for breakfast and the killer view”
Reviews.Author: iloveaixMelbourne
Reviews.Content: ask for room 204

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissVDubai
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from 5 very happy nights staying in Istanbul. We loved Istanbul and I think this is greatly due to the Sari Konak. The staff there are so helpful and thoughtful -nothing is too much trouble. Including a trip to the chemist to buy new antibiotics as I had an allergy to my prescribed drugs. Decor is gorgeous, breakfast is home made and very tasty and the room was comfortable, cosy and very clean. We would not hesitate to recommend it to any traveller. You must also look in the carpet shops next to and opposite the hotel. Both very good and the owners were knowledgeable, honest and charming. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: GiveMeMORE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly friendly, very clean, great location for a first visit to Istanbul, but I don't think I will return there. Be aware that you are coming to the most 'touristy' area in the city. You can walk to all the top attractions, but you will pay for it -- all prices for food are inflated. A taxi ride to Beyoglu is cheap, and your meals will improve. The best meal we had on this trip was in a shabby little square at the Grand Bazaar where there were no tourists in evidence. The most disappointing was one recommended and arranged by Sari Konak. We were picked-up by the restaurant's owner and taken to his restaurant which was clearly otherwise deserted. We were told that this was 'where the Turks eat' - but not for those prices which were even higher than in Beyoglu and the food - very average. The live music we were promised was also shabby. We felt hosed - as is so often the case in Turkey. Our recommendation is for tourists to stray off the beaten track (but of course, if you are female, only with a male companion.)

Reviews.Title: “All that one can ask for”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulBeverlyHills
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5-day sejour at this wonderful little hotel where people and amenities are superb. We had a standard room on the first floor, simple and very clean. Breakfast included a good selection of cereals, breads, cheeses (good Feta which together with tomatoes, cucumbers and some olive oil is the traditional Turkish fare). Unfortunately, during the winter months breakfast is served downstairs and not on the beautiful terrace of the hotel. I can only imagine how lovely it must be to get up to a nice breakfast served with the view of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sofia, and the Bosphorus. The location of the hotel is ideal for visiting the major sites, which are within walking distance. Although I had read that restauranst in the Sultanahmed area were pretty bad my husband and I didn't have one single bad experience; the Four Seasons, which is just around the corner, offers a great dining experience, at a high price, of course. For first time travellers to this wonderful city, this hotel is a must. Experienced visitors may want to venture to other great neighborhoods, such as Bebek and other Bosphorus villages, but expect to pay much more. Most importantly, the people at the Sari Konak, especially Efi, are the most hospitable people you'd find in Istanbul, a city full of the nicest people you'd encounter on this planet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CABay_area_travelers
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sari Konak is conveniently located in the heart of Istanbul. The price was great, staff was super friendly, and rooms were clean and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any traveler that wants to be in the old section of Istanbul. You can literally walk everywhere, even across the bridge over to the new section. One special comment goes out to Sergun who you will typically see in the evenings. He was super friendly, knowledgeable, and, as it turns out, is a master backgammon player. During one of the evenings that we spent relaxing in the hotel, he took time to teach us the game and impart some of his knowledge to us. Truly a great guy, and someone that made the whole experience much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: manasota
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sari Konak Hotel the first week in December. My stay was perfect in every way, starting with my on-line reservation. The english-speaking staff responds to on-line e-mail questions very promptly, which is helpful when planning a trip to a new destination. Since I was staying for a week, I was given a free tax ride from the airport. No problems, no hassle....the Sari Konak staff greeted me when the taxi arrived, helped me bring my things in, and checked me in very quickly. The entire week was as smooth and seamless as the check- in. The staff were so helpful in every way. Elif even helped with shopping suggestions, a good street map, and other ideas of places we might want to see. The hotel has a computer available for use by guests, so it was very easy to check e-mails and keep in touch with those at home. My room was perfect. The bathroom was super, with a nice shower and plenty of space for all my toiletries. I was given large, thick towels every day, as well as nice complimentary toiletries. As other travelers have noted, the breakfast was beyond belief. What a treat! I also enjoyed the freshly squeezed orange juice every morning. The Sari Konak is located in a great section of Sultanahmet. It was easy to walk everywhere I wanted to go. The Arasta Market is only steps away. This market is smaller, but nicer, than the Grand Bazaar. The shops at Arasta all have quality merchandise. There are also other shops within steps from the Sari Konak, as well as many restaurants. And, of course, the Blue Mosque is right outside your room's windows! I can't say enough about this hotel. Go there.....you won't regret it!! The Sari Konak certainly helped make my first trip to Turkey memorable and exceptional. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: mightywease
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is in a perfect position for exploring the sites of Sultanahmet and Istanbul being a short walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome and a slightly longer stroll to Sultanahmet tram stop. The hotel is attractively furnished and being a converted Ottoman house includes traditional Turkish elements and decoration. We had a room on the first landing quite close to the lobby, I have read some criticism from other reviewers that these rooms are rather noisy, however, the combination of long days of walking, a filling Turkish meal and a couple of glasses of Efes meant that we slept like the proverbial logs and hardly noticed any noise. The room was small but comfortable and adequate for two. To be picky I would have perhaps preferred a bit more storage space for clothes and the wardrobe was a rather close to the bed making it difficult to open the doors fully (the solution was to sit on the bead and open it) but those are really very minor criticisms and were more than outweighed by the other advantages the hotel offers. All the staff we dealt with were exemplary, particularly at breakfast, we were made to feel very welcome and that, had we wished, they would have been more than happy to advise re: sightseeing, restaurants etc... Breakfast itself was an absolute pleasure, homemade cake and preserves, olives, meats, fruit cereals and the most delicious creamy white cheese. For the me the highlight of the hotel was the roof terrace with its wonderful views over the rooftops to the Sea of Marmara one way and through the tress to the Blue Mosque the other. We tried to spend at least half an hour there every day, often late afternoon/early evening, to watch the lights go on across the water on the Asian side of the city. Caught there for a couple of hours one day by a horrendous rain storm we sat listening to the rain strike the roof, the distant puttering of boats and then the intermingling calls to prayer from the surrounding mosques. It was a wonderful experience and more than made up for not being able to spend that time exploring the city. The hotel is also close to a number of good restaurants, Albura and Balicki Sabhattin in particular, and the Just Bar on Akbiyik Cadessi is a great place for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but there's better”
Reviews.Author: BOTW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for 4 days in early October prior to boarding our ship for a cruise to Barcelona. We love Instanbul and selected this hotel based on reviews here. The stay was OK, but not great. The good: great location, friendly staff, nice rooftop terrace and great breakfast and breakfast room, clean. The not so good: service and upkeep was mediocre. Examples -- although we were 3 people staying in a suite, we consisitenly got 2 towels. Even when I remeinded them the first night and got a 3rd towel (they gave me one only), the next day the same thing. The suite had several problems that should have been discovered and corrected. the toilet seat was cracked and moved all over the place. The room had one of those energy saving switches where one must insert the room key into a slot upon entering the room to enable electrictiy. Unfortunately ours was cracked and so the power kept going out even with the key in the slot. Calls to the desk brought an attendent who beat on the broken switch till the lights came on again. It worked for an hour our so then the same thing. They never fixed it so one of us had to stand guard at the switch every day while the others used the bathroom! One night we were out late and returned to find the door to the hotel locked and the attendent sould asleep on the sofa in the Internet room. we rang the bell a few times, and knocked at the door but he didn't budge. Not wishing to awaken the entire hotel or wait out in the street in the rain, we went across the street to the Best Western where they took us in. About an hour later, one of the staff came. He didn't seem to care about waking out the guests so he banged at the door and rang the bell till the staff finally woke up and let us in. We then fumbled with the broken switch to keep the lights on long enough to get undressed and into bed. There are many wonderful small botique hotels in the Sultanahmet district. This one was OK, but not as great as we had hoped. When we return in the spring, we'll try a different one.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying With Family!”
Reviews.Author: martyap
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in Istanbul from October 19-24. Everything said about the Sari Konak was true. Not the most luxurious hotel but would not have missed this experience. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Do book the deluxe room. We were on the second floor, front and you could hear street noise especially garbage p/u in the early morning. We visited during Ramadan/Seker Bayrami so there was extra activity in this area. The chant to prayer became our wake up call each morning. Location is perfect. We walked everywhere and took the tram and local bus. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Hippodrome and the Cistern are 5-10 minutes away. We also walked to the Spice Market, Grand Bazaar, over the Galata Bridge and felt very safe. Local restaurants are plentiful and the staff will assist with other choices. But the best feature about Istanbul and the Sari Konak are the people....Elife, Sergun and Murat could not do enough to make our stay picture perfect. They were more like friends.
