Breakfast was great every day as the owner and his sons often greeted every guest. Istanbul is a wonderful city and the Sari Konak is a gem.....would not stay anywhere else. Marty & Karen New York

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base”
Reviews.Author: Oversixty
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just spent 3 nights at the Sari Konak(31/10 - 3/11) and couldn't have wished for a better hotel to stay. The family & staff,the hotel itself,our "de-luxe" twin room,the breakfasts and last but not least, the location - all were just great. This was our first trip to Istanbul and we did a fair amount of research before deciding on the Sari Konak and we couldn't have chosen anything better. Istanbul is a wonderful city - full of beauty and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Fujiman50
Reviews.Content: I am a Professional Travel Photographer and have been working in Istanbul this past week. Because of my job, I have stayed at the good, the bad and the ugly around the world. Believe me when I tell you that this hotel is one of the best ! The location makes it ideal for taking photos, but its the friendly Turkish people you will meet there who I have nothing but praise for. Take my word for it and go and see for yourself. You will not be dissapointed. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Kindest staff I've met!”
Reviews.Author: daveTravels
Reviews.Content: Had a great week with my daughter end of October / beginning of November this year (2006). We both truly enjoyed our visit. Great location in a great city. Large rooms with nice furnishings. Wonderful breakfasts, awesome roofttop terrace. Good prices. Most importantly, very very helpful staff. Had a conflict with reservation and they immediately provided two very nice rooms in place of the suite - at the same cost (almost double the value). Wonderful to talk to, fast with cabs, super with directions, tickets. Even freshly baked breakfast cake every morning. Istanbul is an amazing place - and exotic/different too. Helps to have locals providing insights and support whenever needed. Peeked in on several other hotels in the same neighborhood and elsewhere and felt quite good about our choice. No doubt many other nice places to stay but great people always make such a difference!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Sultanahmet, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: squirrel6
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 days in Istanbul for a cultural sightseeing city break. The hotel I stayed at, the Hotel Sri Konak was outstanding. We stayed first in a standard double ensuite which was spotless and comfortable, and then returned to stay in one of the suites which was spacious, stylish and smart. The staff were so courteous, professional and helpful throughout our stay. The location is perfect. It is one and a half minutes from the Blue Mosque. Go up to the top floor for drinks outdoors in the evening on the verandah which overlooks the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. In the other direction, the Bosphurus Sea stretches as far as the eye can see. Against the October sunset sky, the views of the lit up Blue Mosque are spectacular. The hotel itself is mainly furnished in white, with beautifullly carved wooden doors and original Ottoman pieces. Another plus are the incredible traditional Turkish breakfasts of melon honey and figs. The highlight of the breakfast for me was the soft yoghurt and the home made jams produced by the owner's wife. And yes, there are cornflakes on offer for British wimps who won't try anything new! The hotel itself only offers breakfast and no other meals during the day, but we were within walking distance of some excellent and very reasonable restaurants in the surrounding area. There is also a bazaar in the ground of the Mosque. These boutiques had some of the most interesting and high quality shopping right on our doorstep. The only thing we weren't sure about was the fish restaurant recommended by the hotel on the first night. It was extremely expensive and not that great. Altogether this hotel is a class apart. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Say Yes to Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: AcornMajor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Sari Konak for 3 nights in late-September and echo the positive comments of others, one of the reasons we chose this property in the first place. We booked a deluxe double room overlooking the street and did not receive any unpleasant surprises, although we were visited each night by particularly hungry mosquitos. Room was large and clean. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfasts were tasty with excellent coffee. The Hotel is ideally located for all attractions in the Sultanahmet area and noise was not a problem; after one day, my wife even found the daily call to prayer very soothing. I would recommend this Hotel for anyone wanting a centrally-located property run by caring and professional people.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul?”
Reviews.Author: judi666
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 3 nights at the Sari Konak. If this is the number one hotel in Istanbul, I would hate to see what the worst is like. The staff is wonderful and helpful, however our room was tiny and dingy. We were on the first floor and could hear every word from the night manager and people coming in as well as slamming doors all night. The walls are paper thin and you can hear every event in the rooms around you. There are no chairs or places to sit except the bed. Our toilet leaked the entire time we were there. On the good side the location is great, although there are at least 6 other hotels in the same block. The breakfast was very nice, as was the rooftop bar. This is the second time that the reviews of a hotel on tripadvisor don't seem to match the actual physical experience of the hotel itself. I hope this isn't a tremd. Honestly, this place is two steps above a hostel and maybe one below a Motel 6. I would think it was just the room we had, but I saw 2 others that friends were staying in, that were nearly the same. Perhaps there are better rooms in the hotel. The disturbing thing is that I made the reservation almost a year in advance for a queen-balcony room. What we got was a tiny room with 3 twin beds (although they very promptly made 2 of the beds into one.) and no balcony. We can't say we were a late arrival, as we checked in at 7am (they were very kind to keep our baggage, while we went sightseeing) even though there would be no room available till 1pm. I can't fault the staff as they were really great. Please be aware that this is not some little jewel of a boutique hotel., Maybe there are some great rooms, but we didn't see them and certainly were not offered an upgrade. I would definitely look for something else in a future trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Run Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Baumgartner
Reviews.Content: The Sari Konak Hotel in Istanbul is that small, family run hotel we always look for when we travel to Europe. The location is great, 3 blocks from the Blue Mosque, 5 blocks from Hagia Sofia, and 2 blocks from some good cafes for dinner. We especially liked the Magnaura Cafe. Elif makes great breakfast cakes each morning and was very helpful giving us directions and suggestions. Being Americans, we were a little nervous about going to Istanbul after 9/11. But, we found Istanbul to be the highlight of our trip to Greece and Turkey. It is such a melting pot of the new and the old, christian and islam, europe and asia, that we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Everyone we met were very nice, even the people that were not trying to sell us carpets. The Spice market and Grand bazaar were something to see.

Reviews.Title: “The Way Every Hotel Should Be.”
Reviews.Author: TSJ_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble. The staff were warm and welcoming and this continued for our entire stay which was 6 nights. Our 5 yr old son was treated as an extra special person. The location was central to sites and restaurants in the old city. We will stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “beware one unacceptable room”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn_W
Reviews.Content: Just back from a two-day stay at Sari Konak. Stayed there last year also. Agree with all other reviews that raved about Hotel--we too loved our recent stay there for the reasons cited by others. However, because we stayed in a deluxe room each time, we were unaware of some of the problematic rooms there. The reviewer who gave a low rating because of an unacceptably small room is correct --we saw it and walked through it because it was assigned to a couple we were traveling with. The room was so small that there was barely enough room to step out of the bed. The bathroom was a problem because only a small person could sit on the toilet comfortably. There is no air conditioning or television in the room and, because of its location on a landing just a few steps above the reception desk, all conversations and noise connected with checking in and guests entering and leaving the hotel are easily heard in the room. The rate for this room is the same as for all other regular rooms. The room, thus, was unacceptable and the couple was forced to move to another hotel because the hotel was fully booked. Also, there is one other room that is not air conditioned (the other couple we were traveling with was assigned to that room). The reception desk confirmed that the hotel has two rooms that only have ceiling fans, no air conditioning. Nevertheless, I would still highly recommend this hotel so long as you do not get this teeny noisy room or the other non air conditioned room and are aware that the rooms do vary in size. I personally think that the deluxe rooms are worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Excellent, Amazing, Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Leora
Reviews.Content: This charming boutique hotel is the perfect place to use as home base for all of your Istanbul sightseeing. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are immaculately clean and the terrace is an added treat. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to stay in Old Istanbul. It is just a few minutes walk from all of the major attractions and dozens of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: ma2pon
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Sari Konak where we had a great time. We stayed at the Sari Konak for 5 nights, having chosen it because of reviews on Tripadvisor. I can back up all of the nice comments below, The other reviews were right. I would recommend it to anyone travelling to Istanbul. Especially notable were the friendly staff! Every day we return at the hotel, we were greeted with such warmth. We are interested in Turkish word and tried to speaking Turkish. Ilhan was kind to tearch us various Turkish word every day. When my wife asked about Turkish music, Elif kindly gave my wife her own music CD! You can't imagine how delighted my wife were. Mustafa and Sergen welcomed us back each day. And made reservations for us at Belly dance show. We really enjoyed Turkish Show at Orinent House. The location is excellent for tourists (walking distance to Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Hippodrome and Underground Cistern,Topkapi Palace), and the room was beautifully presented, clean and very comfortable. The roof top terrace has great views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. We will definetely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBetty
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at Sari Konek -- after three days at the pretty fabulous Empress Zoe -- but that was enough! Our room was incredibly small (although my husband said other rooms he walked by were far bigger) -- to the point where I could barely walk around the double bed. I asked for a different room, but was told there was nothing available. We were on the first floor, and had an early flight in the morning -- but every time someone came into the hotel, we heard every word they said -- finally, at 3 am the last couple checked in, walked laughing through the halls, slammed the door a few times, and woke me up for the rest of the night. I had to go out into the breakfast room and lie there reading -- the night clerk was really apologetic and couldn't have been any nicer, but the hotel experience in general was not great. sorry.....

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: Giveret
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in July-Four nights at the begining and 2 at the end of our trip. The service was amazing-just like the best 5* hotels. The front desk staff, particularly Elif were professional and very helpful. They totally dealt with all our requests and problems-our lost luggage from the airport-it was in our room the next day. They arranged an excellent tour guide at the last minute, and most of all, when we arrived for our 2 night stay, the twin bedded room I had booked had no air conditioning. Within 10 minutes, Elif, who just happened to be there on her time off gave us a 2 room suite with kitchen and our own hamam for only 10E more than we had planned to spend. Breakfasts were outstanding, the rooftop view was amazing, and the hotel was quiet with lovely guests. Although our first room was on the small side, I was told this in advance by the owners. This is a very well run hotel, and I highly recommend it for a worry free, relaxing stay in the heart of old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and a great location”
Reviews.Author: apate221
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Hotel Sari Konak. The rooms were clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The staff was more than happy to help us in making dinner reservations, arranging for van service, and assist us in communicating with the Pharmacy when we needed medicine. The breakfast in the morning is terrific and plentiful. They offer cereal and a variety of breads, wonderfully fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, and yogurt, a variety of honey, jams, seeds and noteworthy home made cake that is brought in by the staff everyday. They also make a great cup of coffee. The last time we were in Istanbul, we stayed at the Kempmenski Ciragan Palace, which is much better known and four times the price. We preferred the Sari Konak because of the location and its overall warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my husband and aunt in June 2006 and we had a fabulous experience. The staff was exceptional. The breakfast was fresh & tasty the room was immaculate. We stayed in the newest addition in the basement next door and loved the marble bathroom and comfy beds. We recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimsumdolly
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Sari Konak in june and really enjoyed it. The staff was really friendly and helpful. We loved the rooftop terrace! Only negative comment: we were asked to change room and for the same price we got a way smaller bedroom and bathroom...

Reviews.Title: “LIke an upscale B and B”
Reviews.Author: annabelle29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak for three nights at the end of a two week trip in Europe. The location is fantastic with great roof-top views of the Blue Mosque in Sultanhamet. The hotel is beautiful with wonderful decor. The staff was so helpful and caring, every time we left the hotel, it was like a family member was seeing us off and making sure we had everything we needed for the day. I would've given this an excellent rating if we liked our room more. We tried to get a suite, but they were all booked up. Instead we ended up on the first floor with a super tiny room without a view. We booked about two months out, but perhaps this wasn't enough time. Also, we booked via a hotel booking website which didn't let us know that you can get a 10% discount if you pay with cash. I would recommend booking directly with the hotel, you probably would have a better chance at a nicer room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: onyadon
Reviews.Content: We expected a top-class hotel from all the reviews and Sari Konak more than matched our expectations with considerate, friendly service from Elif/Mustafa/Sergun at the front desk and we enjoyed our room, breakfast and proximity to the major Sultanahmet attractions. It is indeed what everyone says about the Sari Konak.... a wonderful comfortable experience for a traveller to Istanbul. We have many great memories of our stay in Istanbul, and the Sari Konak was very much part of that. Go there, you won't be disappointed. Highly recommended. --- RSM, Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel near all the sites iÄ±n the old City”
Reviews.Author: bwphd
Reviews.Content: We stayed Ä±n a deluxe room wÄ±th king sÄ±ze bed, bathtub. Standard rooms are 30% less and are smallerÅŸ but adequate, and have shower. Rooms have hairdryers, AC, small refrigerators. No laundry or facillities for small children on-site. Wonderful buffet breakfast iÄ±ncluded on the garden patio or inside Ä±f you prefer. Rooftop terrace open in the late afternoon and evenings for drinks and view of the Blue Mosque lit up at night and the Bosphorus. 15 -30 minute cab ride from airport depending on traffic. Ä°t costs about $17 with a 50% surcharge iÄ±n the middle of the night. Hotel gives 10% discount if you book direct by iÄ±nternet (-----------) Free internet access in the hotel business office after business hours. Hotel is a 5 minute walk to Blue Mosque. TopkapÄ± Palace and tram to ferry pier for trip up the Bosphorus. 15 minute walk to Grand Bazaar. Very quiet hotel, even on the street level. Very friendly and helpful staff that will book guides, restaurants and confirm reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Sari Konak is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Sari Konak in Istanbul because of reviews we read on TripAdvisor, and we were very pleased. The location is outstanding--on a quiet, picturesque street within five minutes walk of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace. There are great restaurants also in walking distance. The breakfast was quite good and was served in a very nice setting; there was a terrace on the top floor with a great view of the Blue Mosque and of the sea. The rooms were comfortable. Best of all, the staff was really helpful with recommendations for restaurants and walking routes. It was definitely a good value for the dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel!”
Reviews.Author: doc_rck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sari Konak Hotel for 6 nights at the beginning and an additional 3 nights at the end of our trip to Turkey in June and July, 2006. Our experience there was extremely positive and we cannot recommend Sari Konak highly enough. The hotel is centrally located in Sultanahmet a few blocks from both the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. The street, quiet and lined with small cafes and a few stores, makes for a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere. The roof deck offers wonderful views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara and we spent many an evening enjoying the view and a refreshing drink. We booked a deluxe double room online from New York and received a comfortable, elegantly decorated, and sizable room on the third floor. Breakfast, included in the price, was served outdoors in a beautiful courtyard and included many delectable Turkish specialties and home made baked goods. The staff were attentive and informative and always willing to help during our stay. Especially notable were the front desk staff: Sergun who made reservations for us at innumerable restaurants and helped us find our way there each time, Elif who guided us about the sites and tirelessly made cake every evening after her shift, and Mustafa who staffed the night desk and welcomed us back each day. Overall, we were extremely pleased with Sari Konak Oteli and would return without any hesitatiion.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: Akba
Reviews.Content: The reviews were right on this hotel. A definite number one for Istanbul. The people that work there are absolutely wonderful. The hotel is very close to all major tourist sights and the tram that can take you quickly to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market (ferry Points also) is about a 5-10 minute walk away and is about 60 cents each way (CHEAP and safe, but very, very crowded in the afternoon) The roof top terrace is cool and you have a sweeping view of the city and the ocean. A taxi cost us 12 USD to get there from the airport. An absolutely beautiful hotel and city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sari Konak Hotel in Sultanahmet, Istanbul for five nights in May 2006. We were absolutely delighted with the service given to us by the helpful staff. Because we had booked for 5 nights, we were offered a free pick-up service from the airport to the hotel. The room we were allocated in the first instance was comfortable however an unpleasant smell drove us to request another. This was actioned as soon as possible without a fuss and the problem was investigated and fixed. The Front of House Manager, Elif Efe, was delightful to deal with and she happily made many phone calls and reservations for us. It was our wedding anniversary during our stay and the staff left us a lovely surprise in our room - a bottle of wine, some fruit and a congratulatory message. On the morning I had to leave early for the airport, around 6am, I was given access to the breakfast food so that I could help myself. (the normal breakfast starting time was 8am) We left Istanbul after our stay and returned six days later but could not stay there again as there were no vacancies. Nevertheless, Elif invited us back for drinks one day and afternoon tea the next, all complimentary. We have very fond memories of this hotel and hope that one day we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Istanbul represented the end of a 12 day trip. Our cruise ended in Istanbul on a Saturday morning with a departure, returning to the United States on Monday.Only 2 days to explore. Not nearly enough. The Hotel Sari-Konak staff helped us make the most of our short stay. Specifically, the charming young women named Elif was most helpful with directions, suggestions for dining and whipped up a terrific breakfast cake. How every one would like to have an employee like that. The other desk staff were friendly and helpful in making our brief stay so productive. We will be back at the sari-Konak next time in Istanbul. The location of the Hotel was ideal . Just a short walk to some of the major sites in the Sultanahmet. Our trip took place from May 30 thru June 12, 2006

Reviews.Title: “fabulous sari konak”
Reviews.Author: go'connor
Reviews.Content: We decided to book into the Sari Konak Hotel after having read the trip advisor reviews and the photos posted on the hotel's own website. We expected heaven. We found it. We stayed there for four days in June, and wished we had much more time there. The hotel is very centrally located, though if you don't want to be woken by the early morning call to prayer, don't stay there. it is only yards away from the Blue Mosque, but then if you stay in the old city of Istanbul you will be woken by the call, as there are many, many mosques and they all call the faithful to prayer. We did not have any problem at all with this, in fact I found it strangely comforting. But I heard one American woman complaining about the "noise" from the mosque! We stayed in the suite, which is huge, and very stylish. We were at the end of a 6 week holiday and quite a large amount of luggage, so the extra room was fantastic. They have a safe in the room, which means you don't have to take your valuables with you when you go out. They also offer a laundry service, which was very reasonably priced. Everyone was wonderfully helpful, making recommendations for dinner, cruises, etc. The roof terrace/bar was lovely with a great view of the Blue Mosque behind us, and the sea of Marmara in front, and breakfast was taken in a downstairs courtyard, which was also very stylish. I have raved to everyone about this hotel and can highy recommend it, to anyone - unless, of course, you don't want to hear the call to prayer, in which case I wonder why you'd go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough!”
Reviews.Author: meninabella77
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this lovely hotel. We stayed at the Sari Konak for 4 nights in early June and we had a difficult time leaving to continue our travels in Italy. The location is fantastic, the rooms clean and cozy, the breakfast delicious, but above all, the staff was sensational. Mustafa and Elif were invaluable! They were extrememly knowledgeable and always available to make recommendations and arrangements. Every day/ night we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with such warmth, it felt like coming home, if not better! This is a great place to stay in one of my absolute favorite cities in the world...I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and would stay there again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful "Home Away from Home"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Sari Konak hotel for 4 nights, then returned for one night at the end of our trip. The location was terrific (close to the Blue Mosque and other sights, nice quiet street), the rooms were clean and comfortable, the delicious home made breakfast buffet started our day off right every day, and the price was very reasonable. But what really made our stay special were the wonderful staff (especially Elif!). The service was very personalized, and Elif as well as others on the staff made great recommendations and reservations for us, and generally assisted us with all aspects of our trip. Our trip had a few extra challenges, as my mother is in a wheelchair, there was a fire at the Istanbul airport the day we arrived, and our taxi driver lost a piece of luggage on the way to the airport. But we received an amazing degree of help and support from the staff at the Sari Konak hotel, and it really made our trip special. The rooftop patio is also a great place to relax with a beverage and take in the views.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, friendly and helpful staff at Sari Konak”
Reviews.Author: IamBruce
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Istanbul. Super location, nice clean rooms and very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast is great too. Only one thing that puzzled me a bit - that is, why the hotel doesn't make full use of its wonderful rooftop deck/ounge. I hear that something is in the works though. Bottom line - you can't lose by staying at Sari Konak. Additionally, if you want to buy rugs/carpets while in Istanbul, the place next to the hotel (right next door, called Anatolian Arts) is very good. The owner/manager is an honest and knowledgeable rug professional. I recommend visiting and considering a purchase from Bayram.

Reviews.Title: “ISTANBUL TREASURE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from two weeks in Turkey and two weeks in Greece. We began our journey with six nights at the Sari Konak in Istanbul, and a nicer beginning to a trip could not be imagined. The rooms, the decor, the breakfast, and the roof top lounge, all as wonderful as advertised. What distinguishes this hotel from many other quality places, however, is the staff. We could not have been made more welcome by Elif and the sons of the owner. We felt as if we were "coming home" at the end of each day of sightseeing. We highly recommend the Sari Konak if you are considering a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ualsu
Reviews.Content: We were prepared to be disappointed. Given the wonderful reviews the hotel had received, could any hotel really measure up? It did. The location is fabulous. The rooms are comfortable and spotless. The breakfast is delicious. The owner personally pours coffee in the morning and jokes with the guests. The views from the rooftop terrace are unbelievable and the staff is so eager to serve. We would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Best !”
Reviews.Author: EdLeek
Reviews.Content: Every day at breakfast you'll see the owner, and during the day you'll see one or both of his sons. All speak excellent English, as do the rest of the small staff. All couldn't be any more helpful or friendly. Rooms are spotless. Location very close to major attractions and a short walk to tram. Taxis are always available and very inexpensive. However, don't expect taxi drivers to know the hotel (because it's so small). Inexpensive eateries within a short walk. Beautiful views from the rooftop. One of our favorite hotels of all time--at a budget price.
